story:
In the media

Navigation

The Headset When to use? Timeline
The Hand Controller Content Budget
The App Positioning The Team


What is moggles?

Moggles, short for mobile goggles, is a Virtual Reality Console. Made to fit your pocket. It works with any smartphone with a display size from 4" to 5.7" and is for both iOS and Android!


How does it work?

Games, videos, pictures and homepages, VR is more than just gaming, it is an interface, where you get a feeling of being inside your media. Visit an apartment, explore the space or the oceans, take a virtual tour of your favourite city or simply take a minute off from your stressful life and travel virtually to anywhere in the world.

By using your smartphone together with a pair of Moggles, you get a portable 200” 3D screen with 360 degrees head tracking, anywhere you want. 

All you need to add is your smartphone.

Moggles is a complete VR console that comes together with a hand controller equipped with dynamic motion tracking. 

Moggles works together with all Goggle cardboard (+120 apps available) compatible content. 

Peoples reactions!


The Headset

Moggles folds into itself and becomes small enough to fit in your pocket.


Moggles uses your smartphone as the magic maker. Your smartphone is always accessible and has all the features to create a Virtual Reality experience. If you have a modern smartphone with a screen size of 5,5” or less, Moggles is for you.

The display, sensors, memory, processing power and internet is managed by your smartphone. Every time you update to a new phone, Moggles will also have the latest technology. Buy one pair of Moggles and you will always be able to have the highest resolution headset available. Easy.




  • Works with all smartphones up to 5.5”
  • Foldable and portable with unique pocket size solution
  • Custom made adjustable aspherical lenses for +- two dioptres and IPD  

                        
  • Opening for smartphone cameras to use for Augmented Reality and positional tracking
  • Opening for earphones/chargers on both sides
  • Closed design to reduce light reflections and keep out external light
  • Third strap for more comfortable use during longer sessions.

                          

Comparison

Below is a table of comparison for some specifications of Moggles compared to other VR Headsets.


Moggles LG G3

Moggles iPhone 6+

Oculus DK2

Samsung Gear VR

Sony Morpheus

FOV

93 degrees

93 degrees

100 degrees

96 degrees

90 degrees

Resolution

1280 x 1440

960 x 1080

960 x 1080

1280 x 1440

960 x 1080

Weight

300g

323g

440g

556g

?g

Size

168x30x88

168x30x88

? x ? x ?

198x116x90

? x ? x ?

Platforms

Android, Web

iOS, Web

PC, mobile

Note 4

PS4

Positional tracking

Walk freely

Walk freely

Confined to volume

None

Confined to volume

Input

Hand Controller

Hand Controller

Keyboard, mouse

Hand controller

PS4 controller

More over, these are the main points for which Moggles har been designed.

  • Foldable. Your phone is portable and fits your pocket, why shouldn't your headset?
  • Lenses. We have calculated and experimented a lot with lenses, Moggles has the best single lens system possible. These aspherical lenses which will give you the right focus on the whole display. This will enhance the experience while reducing nausea.
  • Input. Moggles Hand Controller is a simple control that you can navigate with in your sleep.
  • Positional tracking. Positional tracking is one of the important parameters to reduce nausea. It will also give you a lot better immersive experience!
  • Comfortable and ergonomic. Moggles is designed to be light weight, easily adjustable, user friendly and comfortable to wear.
  • Beautiful. We think that Moggles is the best looking headset so far. Don't you agree?

The Hand Controller

Virtual reality is all about immersion (the feeling of being somewhere else) and in time we will even be able to use our hands in VR by tracking them with the camera of the phone. From an ergonomic perspective, working with your hands above your head or in front of your face is not comfortable during a longer time of use. A hand controller is a good complement and known interface which you can use in a comfortable position.

Since there is a need for additional input to the phone, and hand tracking is not ergonomic, we have developed a custom made motion hand controller that fits inside the smartphone holder when Moggles is folded. It has the familiar hand controller interface, a stearing pad with four arrows, four action buttons and L+R buttons.

The best part is that the hand controller has built in sensors to register and use your hand movements. Use it as a laser pointer, a sword, handgun or anything you want. Or, you could even 3D-print a case for the controller, and create a sword or a gun for example! Use the same 3D-file and render it in your VR environment and it will booth feel and look realistic.

  • Motion tracking with built in 6-axis gyro and accelerometer
  • Quick escape button to switch to smartphone camera and a window to the real world
  • Low energy Bluetooth for long lasting battery
  • Rechargable battery to work with standard micro USB chargers
  • Emulates keyboard and mouse - no API needed. Already works with a number of apps that are supporting bluetooth hand controller.

                                

The Software

Today, there are around 100 different demo apps in app stores compatible with Moggles and the content is steadily increasing. We want it to be easy to create, use, browse and share VR experiences. Therefore, we want VR to live on the web. Stream videos, browse pictures, find games and share links to exciting experiences with your friends. No downloads needed. You browse in a seamless user interface. With modern web standards, 3D content in browsers are easy, efficient and works with any phone without app specific code.

The web is a great place to browse and find content but the headtracking needs to be done in an app to run in real time. This is what the Moggles app does.


The Moggles App

The Moggles app keeps track of the head rotations and even reads your position using the smartphone camera. The information is sent to the browser so the content can use this to update the screen.

It gives you positional and rotational tracking for the web. Easy!

To be able to create low latency head positional (camera vision) and rotational tracking (sensor fusion) the algorithms needs to run close to the sensors. With the Moggles app, calculations runs in the app and the content runs in your browser, creating the best VR performance.

The app also customizes your phone for VR mode: locking it in landscape mode, turning the screen saver off, adjusting the display brightness and connects to the hand controller. One button to turn your smartphone into Moggle-mode.

The Moggles app takes care of all the VR-specific stuff so that third party developers can focus on the content for the best user experience!

  • Works with both Android and iOS
  • Algorithms for head rotational and positional tracking
  • Connects with hand controller via Bluetooth
  • Javascript API (for creators), drag and drop to connect to any web content such as video or CAD material.
  • Easy access to relevant smartphone settings.
    • Locks the phone in landscape mode
    • Switches the screen saver off
    • Saves your personal settings
  • Switches to Moggles mode for your personal VR settings from one button.

                                             

Step by step

Start one of all available VR apps or the Moggles web VR app. Replace the hand controller with your phone in the Moggles phone holder. Put Moggles on your head and enjoy!

The display is updated from your heads movement, changing its viewing direction and position using the smartphones sensors and camera. This is not only giving you a portable 200” 3D screen, but also a wireless 360 degrees rotational and positional head tracking device. With Moggles, you can literally walk around in another world.


When to use Moggles?



Available content

There are a decent amount (120+) of apps developed for mobile VR headsets already. In fact, Moggles is compatible with all apps developed for mobile VR headsets like Google Cardboard, VR for LG G3 and so on. So all games or apps developed for other mobile headsets (except Gear VR) works for Moggles as well.

Even the Moggles Hand Controller works for several apps today already. The controler emulates a keyboard and mouse over Bluetooth, so there is no need for an extra API for developers to include it. Most games that uses a controller as input works with the Moggles Hand Controller too! 

With big names such as LG and Google on the same train, you can count on that more content will be developed for mobile VR. Moggles strive to be compatible with all apps developed for mobile VR (except those for Gear VR).

Here are a few selected samples of third party apps that works with Moggles today, some already with the hand controller. For a more in-depth list of VR apps, visit moggles.com 


Panorama video

Panorama cameras are the next revolution of video, and now even Youtube has joined the circus. Instead of capturing a small frame of an event, a panorama camera captures everything in the scene around you!

The best way of watching a panorama video is of course to step into the video and be able to look around, like if you were there! With Moggles, watching panorama videos are natural.

Panorama video streaming of events are just around the corner, with Moggles and a panorama live stream you can be on the scene with your favourite band, sit in the jumbotron on a sports event or participate at a party on the other side of the world!

In Hollywood, production of panorama movies has already begun, the industry loves this new, exciting technology. Youtube has just announced that they will support streaming of panorama videos. There will be a lot of content for Moggles users!


Kolor Panorama Video

A great place to create, upload, browse, share, publish and view panorama 360 videos is at Kolor.

Want to test fly a Hawker Hunter fighter aircraft with Moggles? No problem!

Want to be on stage at a rock concert in Rio with Moggles? No problem!

Take a break from your office and go hiking on the Pineta mountain range. Easy!

                                          

Create your own content

Creating content for VR is easy, even if you are not a developer. There are a couple of panorama video cameras soon hitting the market. Throw away your old action camera and start shooting 360 panorama videos instead!

Videos

Take a look at these cameras

  • Giroptics
  • 360 Hero
  • 360Fly

360 pictures

Here are a number of apps available today to create your own 360 pictures that are available to step into with moggles. Download them today from you app store.

  • Photosynth
  • Bubbli
  • Photo Sphere

Games and Architectural

With our partner Goo technologies it is already possible to create 3D environments by drag and drop your cad files which enables both games and architectural adventures right in your browser. There are several benefits, one mayor is that you won´t fill up your phones memory. Another that you wont need to create app form your project, you can just send a link. Check out their portfolio!


SLAM positioning

We use the camera of your smartphone to track your movements relative to the environment. This means that you will not only be able to look around, but also to walk around in a virtual environment!

With algorithms from the robotics industry in a collaboration with Univrses, walking around in VR is made easy!




Technical Details

A set of Moggles includes a Moggles headset, a Moggles hand controller with motion tracking and a downloadable Moggles app.

The Perks


We have been prototyping

Fig. Mockup/Functional model of moggles.

Fig. Headset and controller folded and packed in a case.

Folding moggles prototype section by section. Still stable once unfolded due to construction and very light weight.


Hand controller prototype.

Where it all started back in 2009. First prototype 2009 (left). First prototype using a smartphone as a screen 2013 (right).

Variations of the open source headset "Open moggles". Download  at moggles.com

Finding the right material to get moggles foldable but still stable. Quality is everything.

Moggles T-shirts

Fresh quality T-shirts from the Haakki factory in Ljungaverk, Sweden. 

"My friend went to virtual reality and all I got was this 2D T-shirt". Make sure you are the friend who went to VR!


Timeline

Where we are now and where we are going.


Where will the funds go?

Taking the hardware to mass production is expensive. The design has to be optimized for production and we need to manufacture custom tools for injection moulding. All parts of the production chain has to be tested and controlled. The hardware also has to pass the CE certification which could be a costly process. The fundings will cover manufacturing costs for the hardware and the development of the app and web platform.

Are you a developer?

Download CAD files for the 3D printable version of Moggles from our homepage. Contact us for more information about the APIs and the app.


The team behind Moggles

Daniel

  • Master of science in technical design.
  • Expertise in visualisation, functional design.
  • Runs the Swedish design agency Rankleven.

Joakim

  • Master of science in engineering physics, specialised in theoretical physics.
  • Runs the Swedish design agency Rankleven.
  • Expertise in robotics, AI and everything technical .

Robin

  • Has been building robots since childhood.
  • Expertise in front- and back end web development.
  • Technical genius. Knows it all.

Jonathan

  • Expertise in marketing and communication.
  • Been working for large world wode companies.

Malin

  • Loves the combination of communication and graphical design.
  • Runs the Swedish graphical design company Kolliderad.
  • Runs the Swedish company Hysch, specialised in sound absorbing interior design.

Sigurd

  • Retoucher and photographer living in New York.
  • Working in the fashion industry for the largest brands in fashion.

Jens

  • Passion for photo and film making.
  • Been involved in several swedish productions for swedish national television.

Thomas

  • Sound technician and songwriter under the name Medelheim.
  • Expertise in all things regarding music, sounds and effects.

Meet us in person!

We are a global company and wants to meet you! Below is our schedule and more will be added. Stay tuned!

  • CES Las Vegas 2-8 January 2015
  • MWC Barcelona 2-5 March 2015, Cancelled 
  • Webbdagarna Stockholm (by internetworld and IDG)
  • Are kapitalmarknadsdagarna, Åre 26-27 2015 March
  • More coming up soon...

The team performing the moggles gang sign with various success in Stockholm, autumn 2014.


Partners

A giant thanks to our partners so far!

Business
STING - Stockholm Business Incubator, www.stockholminnovation.com

Electronics
GAMETEL - Fructel AB, www.gametel.se

Manufacturing
Swemake, www.swemake.com

Software partners
Goo technologies - Makes it possible to create games, architectural explorations, ads and so on in the browser!
Univrses - Merge the real world with the fictive. Place objects in your apartment as if they were there.

Questions?

If you have questions, please take a look in the below FAQ first. If you don't find an answer to your question, we will answer as soon as possible.

If you are logged in on Indiegogo, you can post your questions and comments in the comment section at the top.

We have also started a discussion over at Reddit, we are happy to answer your questions there! Click here to go to the discussion!


FAQ

  • Will I get nauseous from using Moggles?
    There are several factors to why some people get nauseous from using head mounted displays. Most importantly is the conflict in your brain, you see movement but your body isn't moving. This can be reduced by designing the user experience in a smart way. We also do reduce this factor by reading your actual movements, so you can not only look around but also walk around in VR, this technology is called SLAM positioning by using the smartphone camera.
  • Is moggles compatible with the apps for Coogle Cardboard?
    Yes. 
  • How do I create spherical videos?
    You could either buy a 360 camera or build your own rig using several GoPros. See the section about panorama videos.
  • Will there be more apps available in app stores?
    Yes! When we started this project there were none. Thanks to the Google Cardboard project there are now over 100 apps and that number is increasing every day!
  • Can I use Moggles as a portable TV-screen to watch regular 2D/3D-movies?
    Yes! That means that you can enjoy a movie on a 200" 3D screen on the train or wherever you are.
  • Is the Moggles Hand Controller compatible with my phone?
    If you have a modern smartphone with Bluetooth, it shouldn't be a problem! It already works with several apps in App store and Goggle Play.
  • What are the inputs of the Hand Controller?
    The Moggles Hand Controller has a four button arrow pad, four action buttons, L+R-buttons, start/select and motion sensing from a 6DOF accelerometer and gyro.
  • What is the Moggles App used for?
    The Moggles App makes mobile web VR possible. The app does all the heavy lifting in real time and communicates with your browser through a Javascript API. Content can then be placed and browsed in the web, no downloads needed!
  • Do I have to use the Moggles App?
    No, the Moggles App is for browsing web VR content, all other VR apps works on Moggles just as well.
  • Does Moggles support my phone?
    It all depends on the outer dimensions of your smartphone. All phones up to 5.5" will fit, even some with a larger screen, like the Note4. 6 inch phones are usually to large. The maximum outer dimensions supported is 160 x 80 x 10 mm. The experience is also better with a high resolution display and fast GPU/CPU. The best thing is that when you buy a new phone, you will get a better VR experience for free!
  • How confident are you that your planning is reliable?
    We have partnered up with a company started by former Ericsson supply chain managers, they have tons of experience and contacts in production. They will provide the whole production chain, we give them the CAD-files and they take care of everything from manufacturing tooling, testing and CE certifications to assembly and packaging. The timeplan is given by them and we trust them on this. But there is always a risk of course.
story_txt:
In the media


Navigation


The Headset
When to use?
Timeline


The Hand Controller
Content
Budget


The App
Positioning
The Team






 What is moggles?

Moggles, short for mobile goggles, is a Virtual Reality Console. Made to fit your pocket. It works with any smartphone with a display size from 4" to 5.7" and is for both iOS and Android!




How does it work?

Games, videos, pictures and homepages, VR is more than just gaming, it is an interface, where you get a feeling of being inside your media. Visit an apartment, explore the space or the oceans, take a virtual tour of your favourite city or simply take a minute off from your stressful life and travel virtually to anywhere in the world.


By using your smartphone together with a pair of Moggles,  you get a portable 200” 3D screen with 360 degrees head tracking, anywhere you want. 
All you need to add is your smartphone.


Moggles is a complete VR console that comes together with a hand controller equipped with dynamic motion tracking. 
Moggles works together with all Goggle cardboard (+120 apps available) compatible content. 
Peoples reactions!




The Headset



Moggles folds into itself and becomes small enough to fit in your pocket.



Moggles uses your smartphone as the magic maker. Your smartphone is always accessible and has all the features to create a Virtual Reality experience. If you have a modern smartphone with a screen size of 5,5” or less, Moggles is for you.



The display, sensors, memory, processing power and internet is managed by your smartphone. Every time you update to a new phone, Moggles will also have the latest technology. Buy one pair of Moggles and you will always be able to have the highest resolution headset available. Easy.





Works with all smartphones up to 5.5”
Foldable and portable with unique pocket size solution
Custom made adjustable aspherical lenses for +- two dioptres and IPD  
                    

Opening for smartphone cameras to use for Augmented Reality and positional tracking
Opening for earphones/chargers on both sides
Closed design to reduce light reflections and keep out external light
Third strap for more comfortable use during longer sessions.

                      




Comparison

Below is a table of comparison for some specifications of Moggles compared to other VR Headsets.




Moggles LG G3
Moggles iPhone 6+
Oculus DK2
Samsung Gear VR
Sony Morpheus


FOV
93 degrees
93 degrees
100 degrees
96 degrees
90 degrees


Resolution
1280 x 1440
960 x 1080
960 x 1080
1280 x 1440
960 x 1080


Weight
300g
323g
440g
556g
?g


Size
168x30x88
168x30x88
? x ? x ?
198x116x90
? x ? x ?


Platforms
Android, Web
iOS, Web
PC, mobile
Note 4
PS4


Positional tracking
Walk freely
Walk freely
Confined to volume
None
Confined to volume


Input
Hand Controller
Hand Controller
Keyboard, mouse
Hand controller
PS4 controller




More over, these are the main points for which Moggles har been designed.



Foldable. Your phone is portable and fits your pocket, why shouldn't your headset? 

Lenses. We have calculated and experimented a lot with lenses, Moggles has the best single lens system possible. These aspherical lenses which will give you the right focus on the whole display. This will enhance the experience while reducing nausea. 

Input. Moggles Hand Controller is a simple control that you can navigate with in your sleep.

Positional tracking. Positional tracking is one of the important parameters to reduce nausea. It will also give you a lot better immersive experience!

Comfortable and ergonomic. Moggles is designed to be light weight, easily adjustable, user friendly and comfortable to wear.

Beautiful. We think that Moggles is the best looking headset so far. Don't you agree?



The Hand Controller

Virtual reality is all about immersion (the feeling of being somewhere else) and in time we will even be able to use our hands in VR by tracking them with the camera of the phone. From an ergonomic perspective, working with your hands above your head or in front of your face is not comfortable during a longer time of use. A hand controller is a good complement and known interface which you can use in a comfortable position.

Since there is a need for additional input to the phone, and hand tracking is not ergonomic, we have developed a custom made motion hand controller that fits inside the smartphone holder when Moggles is folded. It has the familiar hand controller interface, a stearing pad with four arrows, four action buttons and L+R buttons.




The best part is that the hand controller has built in sensors to register and use your hand movements. Use it as a laser pointer, a sword, handgun or anything you want. Or, you could even 3D-print a case for the controller, and create a sword or a gun for example! Use the same 3D-file and render it in your VR environment and it will booth feel and look realistic.




Motion tracking with built in 6-axis gyro and accelerometer
Quick escape button to switch to smartphone camera and a window to the real world
Low energy Bluetooth for long lasting battery
Rechargable battery to work with standard micro USB chargers
Emulates keyboard and mouse - no API needed. Already works with a number of apps that are supporting bluetooth hand controller.




                                


The Software

Today, there are around 100 different demo apps in app stores compatible with Moggles and the content is steadily increasing. We want it to be easy to create, use, browse and share VR experiences. Therefore, we want VR to live on the web. Stream videos, browse pictures, find games and share links to exciting experiences with your friends. No downloads needed. You browse in a seamless user interface. With modern web standards, 3D content in browsers are easy, efficient and works with any phone without app specific code.


The web is a great place to browse and find content but the headtracking needs to be done in an app to run in real time. This is what the Moggles app does.


The Moggles App

The Moggles app keeps track of the head rotations and even reads your position using the smartphone camera. The information is sent to the browser so the content can use this to update the screen.


It gives you positional and rotational tracking for the web. Easy!





To be able to create low latency head positional (camera vision) and rotational tracking (sensor fusion) the algorithms needs to run close to the sensors. With the Moggles app, calculations runs in the app and the content runs in your browser, creating the best VR performance.

The app also customizes your phone for VR mode: locking it in landscape mode, turning the screen saver off, adjusting the display brightness and connects to the hand controller. One button to turn your smartphone into Moggle-mode.

The Moggles app takes care of all the VR-specific stuff so that third party developers can focus on the content for the best user experience!




Works with both Android and iOS
Algorithms for head rotational and positional tracking
Connects with hand controller via Bluetooth
Javascript API (for creators), drag and drop to connect to any web content such as video or CAD material.
Easy access to relevant smartphone settings.
  
Locks the phone in landscape mode
Switches the screen saver off
Saves your personal settings


Switches to Moggles mode for your personal VR settings from one button.
                                         





Step by step




Start one of all available VR apps or the Moggles web VR app. Replace the hand controller with your phone in the Moggles phone holder. Put Moggles on your head and enjoy!


The display is updated from your heads movement, changing its viewing direction and position using the smartphones sensors and camera. This is not only giving you a portable 200” 3D screen, but also a wireless 360 degrees rotational and positional head tracking device. With Moggles, you can literally walk around in another world.


When to use Moggles?






Available content

There are a decent amount (120+) of apps developed for mobile VR headsets already. In fact, Moggles is compatible with all apps developed for mobile VR headsets like Google Cardboard, VR for LG G3 and so on. So all games or apps developed for other mobile headsets (except Gear VR) works for Moggles as well.


Even the Moggles Hand Controller works for several apps today already. The controler emulates a keyboard and mouse over Bluetooth, so there is no need for an extra API for developers to include it. Most games that uses a controller as input works with the Moggles Hand Controller too! 


With big names such as LG and Google on the same train, you can count on that more content will be developed for mobile VR. Moggles strive to be compatible with all apps developed for mobile VR (except those for Gear VR).


Here are a few selected samples of third party apps that works with Moggles today, some already with the hand controller. For a more in-depth list of VR apps, visit moggles.com 






Panorama video

Panorama cameras are the next revolution of video, and now even Youtube has joined the circus. Instead of capturing a small frame of an event, a panorama camera captures everything in the scene around you!


The best way of watching a panorama video is of course to step into the video and be able to look around, like if you were there! With Moggles, watching panorama videos are natural.


Panorama video streaming of events are just around the corner, with Moggles and a panorama live stream you can be on the scene with your favourite band, sit in the jumbotron on a sports event or participate at a party on the other side of the world!


In Hollywood, production of panorama movies has already begun, the industry loves this new, exciting technology. Youtube has just announced that they will support streaming of panorama videos. There will be a lot of content for Moggles users!


Kolor Panorama Video

A great place to create, upload, browse, share, publish and view panorama 360 videos is at Kolor.


Want to test fly a Hawker Hunter fighter aircraft with Moggles? No problem!


Want to be on stage at a rock concert in Rio with Moggles? No problem!


Take a break from your office and go hiking on the Pineta mountain range. Easy!




                                          


Create your own content

Creating content for VR is easy, even if you are not a developer. There are a couple of panorama video cameras soon hitting the market. Throw away your old action camera and start shooting 360 panorama videos instead!


Videos


Take a look at these cameras


Giroptics
360 Hero
360Fly


360 pictures


Here are a number of apps available today to create your own 360 pictures that are available to step into with moggles. Download them today from you app store.


Photosynth
Bubbli
Photo Sphere


Games and Architectural


With our partner Goo technologies it is already possible to create 3D environments by drag and drop your cad files which enables both games and architectural adventures right in your browser. There are several benefits, one mayor is that you won´t fill up your phones memory. Another that you wont need to create app form your project, you can just send a link. Check out their portfolio!


SLAM positioning

We use the camera of your smartphone to track your movements relative to the environment. This means that you will not only be able to look around, but also to walk around in a virtual environment!


With algorithms from the robotics industry in a collaboration with Univrses, walking around in VR is made easy!







Technical Details

A set of Moggles includes a Moggles headset, a Moggles hand controller with motion tracking and a downloadable Moggles app.



The Perks


































We have been prototyping



Fig. Mockup/Functional model of moggles.




Fig. Headset and controller folded and packed in a case.



Folding moggles prototype section by section. Still stable once unfolded due to construction and very light weight.


Hand controller prototype.






Where it all started back in 2009. First prototype 2009 (left). First prototype using a smartphone as a screen 2013 (right).




Variations of the open source headset "Open moggles". Download  at moggles.com


Finding the right material to get moggles foldable but still stable. Quality is everything.
Moggles T-shirts
Fresh quality T-shirts from the Haakki factory in Ljungaverk, Sweden. 




"My friend went to virtual reality and all I got was this 2D T-shirt". Make sure you are the friend who went to VR!



Timeline

Where we are now and where we are going.






Where will the funds go?

Taking the hardware to mass production is expensive. The design has to be optimized for production and we need to manufacture custom tools for injection moulding. All parts of the production chain has to be tested and controlled. The hardware also has to pass the CE certification which could be a costly process. The fundings will cover manufacturing costs for the hardware and the development of the app and web platform.





Are you a developer?

Download CAD files for the 3D printable version of Moggles from our homepage. Contact us for more information about the APIs and the app.



The team behind Moggles



Daniel

Master of science in technical design.
Expertise in visualisation, functional design.
Runs the Swedish design agency Rankleven.

Joakim

Master of science in engineering physics, specialised in theoretical physics.
Runs the Swedish design agency Rankleven.
Expertise in robotics, AI and everything technical .

Robin

Has been building robots since childhood.
Expertise in front- and back end web development.
Technical genius. Knows it all.

Jonathan

Expertise in marketing and communication.
Been working for large world wode companies.

Malin

Loves the combination of communication and graphical design.
Runs the Swedish graphical design company Kolliderad.
Runs the Swedish company Hysch, specialised in sound absorbing interior design.

Sigurd

Retoucher and photographer living in New York.
Working in the fashion industry for the largest brands in fashion.

Jens

Passion for photo and film making.
Been involved in several swedish productions for swedish national television.

Thomas

Sound technician and songwriter under the name Medelheim.
Expertise in all things regarding music, sounds and effects.



Meet us in person!

We are a global company and wants to meet you! Below is our schedule and more will be added. Stay tuned!




CES Las Vegas 2-8 January 2015

MWC Barcelona 2-5 March 2015, Cancelled 
Webbdagarna Stockholm (by internetworld and IDG)
Are kapitalmarknadsdagarna, Åre 26-27 2015 March
More coming up soon...



The team performing the moggles gang sign with various success in Stockholm, autumn 2014.


Partners

A giant thanks to our partners so far!

Business
STING - Stockholm Business Incubator, www.stockholminnovation.com
Electronics
GAMETEL - Fructel AB, www.gametel.se
Manufacturing
Swemake, www.swemake.com
Software partners
Goo technologies - Makes it possible to create games, architectural explorations, ads and so on in the browser!
Univrses - Merge the real world with the fictive. Place objects in your apartment as if they were there.
Questions?
 If you have questions, please take a look in the below FAQ first. If you don't find an answer to your question, we will answer as soon as possible.


If you are logged in on Indiegogo, you can post your questions and comments in the comment section at the top.


We have also started a discussion over at Reddit, we are happy to answer your questions there! Click here to go to the discussion!


FAQ


Will I get nauseous from using Moggles?
    There are several factors to why some people get nauseous from using head mounted displays. Most importantly is the conflict in your brain, you see movement but your body isn't moving. This can be reduced by designing the user experience in a smart way. We also do reduce this factor by reading your actual movements, so you can not only look around but also walk around in VR, this technology is called SLAM positioning by using the smartphone camera. 

Is moggles compatible with the apps for Coogle Cardboard?
    Yes. 

How do I create spherical videos?
    You could either buy a 360 camera or build your own rig using several GoPros. See the section about panorama videos.
  

Will there be more apps available in app stores?
    Yes! When we started this project there were none. Thanks to the Google Cardboard project there are now over 100 apps and that number is increasing every day!
  

Can I use Moggles as a portable TV-screen to watch regular 2D/3D-movies?
    Yes! That means that you can enjoy a movie on a 200" 3D screen on the train or wherever you are.
  

Is the Moggles Hand Controller compatible with my phone?
    If you have a modern smartphone with Bluetooth, it shouldn't be a problem! It already works with several apps in App store and Goggle Play.

What are the inputs of the Hand Controller?
The Moggles Hand Controller has a four button arrow pad, four action buttons, L+R-buttons, start/select and motion sensing from a 6DOF accelerometer and gyro.
  

What is the Moggles App used for?
  The Moggles App makes mobile web VR possible. The app does all the heavy lifting in real time and communicates with your browser through a Javascript API. Content can then be placed and browsed in the web, no downloads needed!
  

Do I have to use the Moggles App?
  No, the Moggles App is for browsing web VR content, all other VR apps works on Moggles just as well.
  

Does Moggles support my phone?
  It all depends on the outer dimensions of your smartphone. All phones up to 5.5" will fit, even some with a larger screen, like the Note4. 6 inch phones are usually to large. The maximum outer dimensions supported is 160 x 80 x 10 mm. The experience is also better with a high resolution display and fast GPU/CPU. The best thing is that when you buy a new phone, you will get a better VR experience for free!
  

How confident are you that your planning is reliable?
We have partnered up with a company started by former Ericsson supply chain managers, they have tons of experience and contacts in production. They will provide the whole production chain, we give them the CAD-files and they take care of everything from manufacturing tooling, testing and CE certifications to assembly and packaging.

The timeplan is given by them and we trust them on this. But there is always a risk of course.

story:
What is RAIO? RAIO is a panel PC with touch screen based  on  Raspberry Pi. It is a simple solution for  everyone  who wants  to  use  Pi platform. We  decided  to  make durable plastic case for 15" LCD screen size to create a complex station for open source desingers
Our   project  is  intended  to  facilitate  the  use  of  Raspberry   Pi.  The  users  get  a computer with Raspberry heart ready for playing.

3D model from sketchfab:


What is inside RAIO?    Basic RAIO parts

What can you do with RAIO?

Pictures based on RAIO prototype metal case.

Who is it for?
  • computer home users
  • electronics hobbyist
  • programming students
  • young developers
  • programming and electronics school teachers
  • teaching organizations


Custom RAIO
You  can  prepare  your   own  RAIO  casing  version  tailored  to  your  own  needs.
Our  project  allows  for  the  modification  of  the front panel which is changed to implement  your  idea. This  will give you the  possibility to equip your casing with extra buttons, joysticks, expansion ports and PCB extending cards. 

Sample project of the oscilloscope based on the Bitscope platform with two BNC outputs and a 10-pin IDC connector.

We  will  make the front panel on the basis of your own design prepared by you at custom.raio.eu.  Please   send  us  your   file  at  custom@raio.eu  by  10.15.2015.
You can  also  download CAD/DWG and prepare it for us. We allow you to modify your computer after you purchase will not lose guarantee.

In addition, at the back of the casing, we prepared an extra pocket which you can use  in  many  different  ways.  Each  RAIO  version  is equipped  with such pocket.

Back pocket for additional boards.

Rewards:


Choice your model of RAIO
         All versions include plastic raio housing

RAIO GIFT

Help our computers get  to  organizations  which  teach children programming and electronic design, as well as introduce them  to Open Source. Together, we can help any   foundation,   giving   it   a   powerful  development  platform  called  RAIO  GIFT. Our  encounters with young  participants of the Coder Dojo foundation have proven how easy to use  and stimulating the RAIO computer  is. Help to inspire and support young people who want to create their own technology. Just fund one RAIO Gift and we will deliver it at our own expense to any organization in the world.

Such organization may be one of the following:
- CoderDojo.org  You can select the unit you want to support from a list
- Codeclub.org.uk

If  you know any foundation which we can jointly support, please send us the details at office@raio.eu. If you donate one RAIO GIFT, you will receive our unique goodwill rewards  certificate,   and  your  RAIO  GIFT  computer  casing  will  have  your name written on it.


All we need is You


We  need  your support  to execute the injection mould for  manufacturing  plastic cases for RAIO.  We have prepared  3D RAIO casing models and then sent them to the manufacturers of injection moulds. Following consultations, we received price offers for preparing injection moulds for RAIO cases.  Based on that we estimated the costs related to launching complex production of RAIO PC panels.

We  completed  the prototype  version  of  RAIO  for  tests  with the cases made of  metal,  which  we  used  as  the  platform   for  Raspberry  for  5 months. Our team  provided  the  prototype   for  tests  to  the  most  demanding  group  of users,  the young enthusiasts from Coder Dojo.   RAIO  enabled  introduction  of  its  users  to
the  world  of  Raspberry Pi  in  a  friendly  manner.  In   order   to   make   the  RAIO
project real, we need $ 68 000.  This   amount  will  let  us launch  the  production
of  RAIO,  thanks  to  which  we  will  be  able  to introduce in the market cheap and practical  sets   for  working  with  Raspberry Pi.  At the moment the only thing  we  need  is  your  help  to make RAIO project real.

PRODUCTION TIMELINE


Risks & Chalenges
Itouch System is a company which has been handling the production of panel PCs for industry for 10 years. We came up with the idea of building a cheap  PC  based    on Raspberry platform over a year ago. When designing the RAIO case,  we  could  not allow  for  limiting the opportunities provided by Pi. For  this  reason, RAIO  has   the option of preparing an individual version of each case. We have at our disposal the front panel, which we are free to adjust  to our needs  by  adding  extensions Pi (pi hats), buttons, prototype discs, I/O ports, USB or RS232 ports. Additionally, in the  casing  sheathing  we  have  a  pocket,  which  we  may  also  use for additional configurations expanding the possibilities of Raspberry.

We have developed a simple website custom.raio.eu, where you can prepare  your own version of RAIO casing, which  we  will execute for you. The components used for  manufacturing   RAIO  are  proven  subassemblies,  which  were  tested  in  our professional   solutions   for   industry.   We   need   6   months  for  completing  the processes  related to  launching  constant  production  of  RAIO  Panel PCs. During this  time  we  will  keep  you  informed  about  progress  in  the completion of RAIO project via our Facebook and Twitter profiles.

story:
Hi, Thank you for viewing this project. 


Sick of checking whether your iGadget has completed charging itself? 

Well our project is designed to let you know that it is ready for use. 
Would not life be easier if we knew that our phone is fully charged, 
even from a distance? 

Visualize These: 

You are relaxing in your lazy chair. 
Your phone is 6 feet away. 
You reach for your phone. 
BATTERY CHARGE = 50%. 

Is it all even worth the trouble? 

You and I know the countless times we check our phones. 

Imagine your charging cables all with a simple yet immensely effective 
LED Light that informs you about your charge status. At a glance from 
viewing distance, we would be able to know if our gadgets are fully 
charged or not, without even disrupting work flows. 

It’s simple really. 

Red, your phone is not ready buddy. 
Blue, you can cool off now; your phone is ready for use.

The illuminous Smart Cable is an intelligent solution to your 
i-gadgets. Pledge and revolutionize charger cables, simply because it 
makes absolute sense that cables are meant to be intelligent.

Help us fund this project. 
Make illuminous Smart Cable available, high in quality, 
cost-effective. We need funding to mold the parts. We'd like to make 
this product available to the masses and we need your help. The money 
we raise will go directly to making it happen. 

The quicker we achieve our $8000 we'll be able to offer different 
variations. Share our idea; make illuminous Smart Cable possible! 

Thank you for backing this project!

story:
Update 02

We thought that with the money we saved thanks to Influxis we could give to all our contributors starting from Silver perk a t-shirt with an exclusive art from Gerard Cornella Mirambell.

Gerard is a talented artist that worked for animated movies like Chico & Rita. You could find more info here:

- web: http://www.gerardcornella.com/
- blog: http://gerardcornella.blogspot.com.es/
- vimeo: https://vimeo.com/gerardcornella

Also we want to introduce two new features on Teleport:

- Click or tap a link in your device and select where you want to open it.
- Close sessions remotely to avoid security problems and other nasty scenarios.

Hope you like it!! :D

Update 01

We’re so happy to announce our first Parnter. Influxis will provide support with Free Dedicated P2P for one year valued in US$6000.

Influxis is one of the best solution for streaming and P2P service on the web, so we’re really proud about their confidence in Teleport!

We will modify our budget. Now we have US$6000 more to post new features so stay tunned for news very soon!

 

Why Teleport?

A couple of years ago, we had this very question. Why? Why can’t we just send a file to a friend? Directly. Without uploading the content, sharing folders, using up our cloud storage, and all the mess entailed in simply sending a file.

Two years have passed since that original question, and we’re pretty sure that there’s a lot of people in our same situation. But no one has done anything to solve the problem.

Because it IS a problem.

So, a few months ago, we were dining in a restaurant, and the idea comes up again and we decided to make it a reality. We are two software engineers with more than 10 years experience developing for the web and devices that reach millions of users.

We know how to solve the problem, and we need your help.

The P2P private network.

Teleport is a P2P private network for sharing content. Just log in with your Teleport account and start sending content straight away.

Everybody loves to share files: photos, videos, documents, music and much more. With Teleport you can share large files in a few clicks through P2P. And it’s easy, private, secure and fast.

How does it work?

Every time a user sends a file, the recipient will see a notification containing important information, like the filename, file type, size and who is sending the content, so that you can decide to accept the file or not.

All users accepting the transfer would get access to a private live chat room where they could talk to each other and keep track of the transfer progress.

Check out our user interface video!

Teleport is easy.

Sharing files with Teleport is really easy, just select one or more friends to send a file and the content you want to share and Teleport will create a P2P channel where all your friends will connect.

We also thought about mobile technology. You can select the device on which you want to download the file. So if you are on the bus and your friend is sending you 1GB, just select your home PC and download it to that device remotely.

Teleport is private.

We want to emphasize that, WE WILL NOT SELL YOUR DATA. Teleport is private; we are not going to sell your data, your transfer information, or anything else.

We believe that it’s better for you to have control over your data, and for that reason, we are not doing business with your content.

You and your content are safe. Trust us.

Teleport is secure.

Every time you start a channel to share content with your friends, only you and your selected friends can access that room. The data is sent in sliced encrypted packages, and yes, it’s really hard to break that security.

We really care about your privacy and security. We think that this is really important in file transfers.

Teleport is fast.

P2P is the fastest way to share content. All your Teleport transfers will be in a P2P mesh where, the more users the merrier. Also, video and audio will be offered in streaming to allow you to play it during the download process.

Do the math. With ten users in a P2P mesh and an average upload rate of 300KB/s, you can download at just 3MB/s.

Forget waiting for uploads. With Teleport you don’t need to upload anything to the cloud because you are uploading content directly to your friend or your device.

And we take care of connection problems by caching the packages locally in order to reconnect when you are back online.

What do you get?

Once we finish developing the application, we will be offering Free accounts with 2GBs monthly data transfer on one connected device. For our contributors, we’re offering Teleport Pro accounts with unlimited monthly data transfer and three simultaneously connected devices.

Also, we’re offering you the possibility to be a beta tester and try the application before it hits the market. You could even improve Teleport with suggestions!

Finally, we have a special perk called “The Higgs Partner” that will allow you to place a banner on our website for one full year, provide Teleport Pro accounts for all the employees and also early information about our future plans and upcoming Enterprise accounts.

Your help is our success.

Currently, Teleport is just a prototype, but there’s a lot of work to do and with your help, we can make Teleport a reality. If you want to share files like you always wished for, then help us.

We need funding to build the back-end, develop and design the tablet and PC version, lease servers, and buy software licenses to finalize the development of Teleport. We have a lot of work to do, and we estimate we will need three or four months of full-time development.

Here is our budget estimation:

  • 2 Back-end developers: US$28,000
  • 2 Front-end developers (tablet and PC): US$28,000
  • 1 Designer (tablet and PC): US$7,200
  • 1-year P2P servers: US$6,000 Powered by Influxis
  • Legal advisors: US$5,600
  • 9% IndieGoGo and taxes: US$6,200

With the extra funds, we plan to hire more developers, add other platforms, run advertising campaigns, and add more features that we will unveil if we reach the goal. You will be amazed by those new features!

We are open to any suggestion, so please, let us know what you think about Teleport.

Thank you so much!

Finally, we have a special perk called “The Higgs Partner” that will allow you to place a banner on our website for one full year, provide Teleport Pro accounts for all the employees and also early information about our future plans and upcoming Enterprise accounts.

Currently, Teleport is just a prototype, but there’s a lot of work to do and with your help, we can make Teleport a reality. If you want to share files like you always wished for, then help us.

Here is our budget estimation:

2 Back-end developers: US$28,000
2 Front-end developers (tablet and PC): US$28,000
1 Designer (tablet and PC): US$7,200
1-year P2P servers: US$6,000 Powered by Influxis

Legal advisors: US$5,600
9% IndieGoGo and taxes: US$6,200
With the extra funds, we plan to hire more developers, add other platforms, run advertising campaigns, and add more features that we will unveil if we reach the goal. You will be amazed by those new features!
We are open to any suggestion, so please, let us know what you think about Teleport.
Thank you so much!

story:
The Story

Instagram now literally has become a part of our lives. Almost every day, we share photos and videos in our stories and follow the postings of our friends. In addition, only the followers can see the story we share, or if our account is public, Instagram can show us on the list of suggestions. We thought that there was something missing. With this feature you can see and follow the stories of people who are 1 - 35 km away from you. In line with your curiosity, would not you like to watch shared stories in any country you want? Storynear has the ability to show stories you share on Instagram to other Instagram users, even if your profile is not public.

Visit our site.

 

App Features

 

Explore

You can see shared stories on locations nearby and thus be able to explore popular places.

 

Nearby People

By choosing the gender and distance of your interest you can explore the stories from the Instagram users nearby in a filtered way. With this feature you will be able to find real profiles. Moreover, you can connect through Instagram with those people and gain new followers.

 

 

Our income sources

Offering in-app purchases and displaying ads. Those ads will not disturb you in any way.

 

In-app products

Unlimited story

Enables you to share unlimited stories. Without this purchase, the number of your stories that are shown will be 4.

Viewers

Shows you who likes and watches your stories.

Global

Explore the stories in the country you have chosen and display your stories there respectively. With this feature, you can meet people from foreign countries and follow their posts closely.

Premium

Be able to use all packages.

 

Deadline

Our development continues on the iOS and Android platforms. On 25th May 2019 it will be published in the app stores.

 

Risks and challenges

The risks and challenges of the application depends on its promotion and advertisement. As a team we are working on different ideas about advertising to attract the attention of the social media users.

story:
With elaico it will be possible not only to see and talk to one another over the internet, but also to feel and touch one another.

"Adding the beauty of sense to the internet."

 elaico - sight, sound and sense

The tools of communication almost evolve on a daily basis, however the way of communicating over the Internet has barely changed at all in the past 10 years. We will change that! With elaico it will be possible not only to see and talk to one another, but also to feel and touch one another. Falling in love over the Internet is nothing unusual these days. Therefore long distance relationships are more common in our society. But it´s not easy to keep them going, because of the lack of intimacy and sensuality. The missing piece between the needs of today‘s generation and state-of-the-art technology is called elaico. We will close this gap and give people all over the world a tool to feel real emotion over the Internet.

Products

„Black and white, two hearts with one soul, crafted to get lost in beauty and pleasure.“

But enough with all the jabbering, lets get down to the facts. All products will be available for men and women and run wireless to provide more comfort and flexibility.

elaico vybby & remote

elaico vybby (for women)

- The ABS shells will get a refined finish for haptic purposes 
- 1 part made of smooth body-safe silicone
- 2 motors for thrilling vibrations
- on / off switch - rechargeable batterie
- Bluetooth antenna on the circuit board
- Plug in connection to load batterie
- A garterbelt with a simple retainer

elaico vybby


vybby remote

- The ABS shells will get a refined finish for haptic purposes
- 2 button interface
- 1 vibrating motor for haptic feedback 
- on / off switch
- battery compartment
- Bluetooth antenna on the circuit board

vybby remote


phlux (for men)

- The ABS shells will get a refined finish for haptic purposes
- parts of the product will be covered with smooth body
-safe silicone
- 2 motors for thrilling vibrations
- on / off switch
- rechargeable batterie
- Bluetooth antenna on the circuit board 
- Plug in connection to load batterie 
- Clip system for mounting

elaico phlux


phlux remote

- The ABS shells will get a refined finish for haptic purposes
- motion sensor
- 3 button interface
- 1 vibrating motor for haptic feedback
- on / off switch
- battery compartment 
- Bluetooth antenna on the circuit board

phlux remote


elaico Community

Of course our sensual network will have all of the necessary standards, like customizable profiles, picture upload, messaging, etc. What makes it special though is the seamlessly implementation of skype, the smart connection between people and devices and the overall easy to use interfaces. 
Basicly the sensual network will be divided into 3 areas. 

Solo – first experience 
a secure area to familiarize with elaico.

Couples – private room 
a safe haven to adore your one and only love. Absolute privacy for couples. 

Friends - meet and play 
a playground for everyone who fancies it.


Connection via Skype

The elaico hardware will be connected to the PC over a Bluetooth connection. The data will be transmitted via skype. The devices can be controlled using a Skype Extra tool enabling the transmission of sight, sound and sense. This tool is synchronised with the elaico community.


Contributors

This idea has equaly fascinated designers, technitions, software specialists, prototype builders and marketing specialists. This enthusiasm has formed a team, which is capable of turning elaico into reality. This is what we got so far:

  • A big developer and manufacturer of circuit boards with more than 40 years of experience. (To control our devices.)
  • Professional consulting services for silicones. (For sensitive fun parts)
  • Specialists in development, precise manufacturing and finishing  of plastic components for cosmetics,  medical and food purposes. (For refined surfaces and body proof aplications)
  • Customer Relationship Management. (For precise and descrete support services)
  • A small but very sophisticated industrial design agency with a co-creative mindset. (For unique and beautiful designed products)
  • A modern software development company (For the skype connection and usability)
  • Excellent and careful consultation for accountancy matters and tax advice. (To set up our project properly and within applicable rules and laws.)
  • Business consulting with a focus on the financial aspect. (For a substantial and functional business plan, careful financing and meticulous controlling)
  • A innovative web design and strategic network development company. (To create a sensual media network with perfect usability.)
  • Distinct and progressive Marketing (To optimize marketing and the image of the project)

Goals

Our Goal is to manufacture prototypes for all 4 products for alpha testing. With these prototypes we have the possibility to develop serial production and profound marketing with the help of further investors. Of course we would love to go the whole way with you. But we will cross that bridge, when we come to it.

Risks and Challenges

With a project like elaico the biggest risk is the size of the project itself. The required know how is huge. This is a problem, but it is not a reason to give up. In order to handle this problem we have built a professional team of supporters who are specialized and experienced in the required areas.

story:
About The Active Alarm

The Active Alarm is the first and only automatic device that can prevent home fires.  Simply plug your stove into the Active Alarm and then plug the Active Alarm into the wall. Once your smoke alarm sounds, the Active Alarm hears the alarm and cuts the power to the stove thereby preventing the fire.

The Idea 

The Active Alarm was conceived by firefighter Peter Thorpe as he consistently went on fire calls where someone had left something cooking on the stove. Sometimes, the home or building is in flames. Peter thought: “there has to be a way to stop the fire once the smoke alarm is blaring before the fire starts.” 

What does the Active Alarm do?

Active Alarm cuts off power to the heat source. Stove fires can smoke for hours before actually igniting into flame. The Active Alarm hears when the smoke alarm is activated and cuts the power to the stove. This removes the power source from the potential fire causing material and stops the fire before it starts. 

Is the Active Alarm necessary?

The number one location of home fires is in the kitchen. The number one cause of kitchen fires… unattended cooking. Have you ever left the kitchen with something cooking and forgotten about it? Have you ever left home wondering if you turned off the oven or stove? Have you experienced a home fire or know someone who has? 

In the United States, over 150,000 fires are caused each year just by unattended cooking. These cooking fires cause over $750 million in property damage. Still other fires are caused by clothes dryers and other appliances. 

By stopping the fire during the smoking phase, the Active Alarm can prevent these fires and save billions of dollars in property damage. There is no other fire prevention device that prevents the fire before it starts. 

We think Smokey the Bear would be proud.

Fire Scenario…

If a fire starts in your home while you’re there, you’d probably hear the fire alarm and investigate the smoke. You may then call the fire department. If you’re not there, hopefully the neighbors notice the smoke from the house and call the fire department to drive over and put it out.  But with an Active Alarm, as soon as the fire alarm sounds, Active Alarm starts counting down from 3 minutes. If the smoke alarm stops sounding within 3 minutes or if you turn off the appliance, the Active Alarm knows you took care of it. Otherwise, Active Alarm cuts power to the appliance, thereby preventing a fire and stopping the smoke. 

Frequently Asked Questions

What if I accidentally set off my smoke alarm while cooking? 
The Active Alarm has an intelligent 3 minute delay that allows those of us who aren’t the best cooks to clear out the smoke before the Active Alarm cuts the power to the stove. The 3 minutes is plenty of time to clear out smoke or shut off the smoke alarm before the Active Alarm interrupts the power supply to the stove. 

How can I reset the Active Alarm? 
The Active Alarm is reset by flipping the breaker in your electrical panel off and back on again. This way you won’t have to pull out your stove if you need to reset the unit.

What Kind Of Appliances Does The Active Alarm Work With? 
The device currently works with stove and oven units using 220 volt power. Our device currently doesn't work outside of the US or Canada. 

How Did You Develop Active Alarm? 
First, we created a bread board to figure out which circuit type would work best. Then, we moved into 110V circuit boards to get a basic feel for the space and components that would be required. After that, we created several 220V prototypes to get a sense of the look and the feel. Our next stage of development is to create a user-ready device. 

The Next (and final) Step

We have made some amazing progress in developing the Active Alarm. We are now at the final stage of development. The funds raised using Indiegogo will go towards costs of finalized engineering, ETL certification, and mold and manufacturing costs. We have partnered up with a local design firm and lab for final design specs and a local manufacturing company to build the units. We are excited to be so close to the finish line of getting these built!

Our Team

The alarm concept was created by firefighter Peter Thorpe. He got together with his trusted engineering friends, Michael and Zack, who engineered the device. Then Rhett joined to help people learn about the device and bring it to as many homes in the U.S. as possible. 

We need your help, Indiegogo! We have a working prototype already developed. We need your help to finalize the manufacturing of these devices. So tell someone you know who might think this device is cool or important. And above all, back us!

 

Note on perks: The t-shirt and first aid kits have estimated delivery of November 2012. The Active Alarm units have an estimated deliver by Spring 2013.
story_txt:
About The Active Alarm
The Active Alarm is the first and only automatic device that can prevent home fires.  Simply plug your stove into the Active Alarm and then plug the Active Alarm into the wall. Once your smoke alarm sounds, the Active Alarm hears the alarm and cuts the power to the stove thereby preventing the fire.

The Idea 
The Active Alarm was conceived by firefighter Peter Thorpe as he consistently went on fire calls where someone had left something cooking on the stove. Sometimes, the home or building is in flames. Peter thought: “there has to be a way to stop the fire once the smoke alarm is blaring before the fire starts.” 
What does the Active Alarm do?
Active Alarm cuts off power to the heat source. Stove fires can smoke for hours before actually igniting into flame. The Active Alarm hears when the smoke alarm is activated and cuts the power to the stove. This removes the power source from the potential fire causing material and stops the fire before it starts. 

Is the Active Alarm necessary?
The number one location of home fires is in the kitchen. The number one cause of kitchen fires… unattended cooking. Have you ever left the kitchen with something cooking and forgotten about it? Have you ever left home wondering if you turned off the oven or stove? Have you experienced a home fire or know someone who has? In the United States, over 150,000 fires are caused each year just by unattended cooking. These cooking fires cause over $750 million in property damage. Still other fires are caused by clothes dryers and other appliances. By stopping the fire during the smoking phase, the Active Alarm can prevent these fires and save billions of dollars in property damage. There is no other fire prevention device that prevents the fire before it starts. We think Smokey the Bear would be proud.
Fire Scenario…
If a fire starts in your home while you’re there, you’d probably hear the fire alarm and investigate the smoke. You may then call the fire department. If you’re not there, hopefully the neighbors notice the smoke from the house and call the fire department to drive over and put it out.  But with an Active Alarm, as soon as the fire alarm sounds, Active Alarm starts counting down from 3 minutes. If the smoke alarm stops sounding within 3 minutes or if you turn off the appliance, the Active Alarm knows you took care of it. Otherwise, Active Alarm cuts power to the appliance, thereby preventing a fire and stopping the smoke. 
Frequently Asked Questions
What if I accidentally set off my smoke alarm while cooking? The Active Alarm has an intelligent 3 minute delay that allows those of us who aren’t the best cooks to clear out the smoke before the Active Alarm cuts the power to the stove. The 3 minutes is plenty of time to clear out smoke or shut off the smoke alarm before the Active Alarm interrupts the power supply to the stove. 
How can I reset the Active Alarm? The Active Alarm is reset by flipping the breaker in your electrical panel off and back on again. This way you won’t have to pull out your stove if you need to reset the unit.
What Kind Of Appliances Does The Active Alarm Work With? The device currently works with stove and oven units using 220 volt power. Our device currently doesn't work outside of the US or Canada. 
How Did You Develop Active Alarm? First, we created a bread board to figure out which circuit type would work best. Then, we moved into 110V circuit boards to get a basic feel for the space and components that would be required. After that, we created several 220V prototypes to get a sense of the look and the feel. Our next stage of development is to create a user-ready device. 
The Next (and final) Step
We have made some amazing progress in developing the Active Alarm. We are now at the final stage of development. The funds raised using Indiegogo will go towards costs of finalized engineering, ETL certification, and mold and manufacturing costs. We have partnered up with a local design firm and lab for final design specs and a local manufacturing company to build the units. We are excited to be so close to the finish line of getting these built!
Our Team
The alarm concept was created by firefighter Peter Thorpe. He got together with his trusted engineering friends, Michael and Zack, who engineered the device. Then Rhett joined to help people learn about the device and bring it to as many homes in the U.S. as possible. 
We need your help, Indiegogo! We have a working prototype already developed. We need your help to finalize the manufacturing of these devices. So tell someone you know who might think this device is cool or important. And above all, back us!

 
Note on perks: The t-shirt and first aid kits have estimated delivery of November 2012. The Active Alarm units have an estimated deliver by Spring 2013.

story:
The Idea:

We designed the NotiMe during a dinner with our friends.

One of them was waiting for an important message, and she was checking its phone every second.

Suddenly she asked "Do you know what I need? Something to alert me on missed call. Like the one I had on my old phone!"

Simple and clear!! A colorful light able to catch your attention when needed.

After several trials, we finally developed the NotiMe with in focus the reliability and robustness.

But you should bring it with you and when attached to your phone/tablet it doesn't have to be cumbersome.

So we went through various designs until we matched the perfect size. Not too small to lose it, not too big to feel it when the phone is in your pocket.

But we are ambitious and with your help we can further minimize it.

WHY THIS CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT FOR ME:

This is my very first campaign and I spent a lot of time (more than a year) designing and testing it.

There are different ways to contribute to this project. If you can’t donate please share it with your friends and If they don’t buy it telling they lost your message, then you have an chance to taunt him for not contribute to this useful device.

To contribute, please share this project with your friends.

The more people share this project, the more chance we have to reach the goal.

The NotiMe instruction:

The NotiMe works as a simple USB device. It needs only an USB Host or USB OTG port on your device.

Instruction:

Take your NotiMe

Just plug it in your USB port

Do whatever you want, free to not miss anything again.

Well, you might think that this section is too short, but really there is nothing more to say.

Just one simple step. Plug it in your USB port.

Do you want to know what is real outstanding?

Since it is a real multiplatform device, it can be unplugged from pc and plugged in you tabled as your needs.

If you are a business man, you could benefit from NotiMe notification:

Transport it with you and plug in your work computer to wait for an email from your boss, go to have a lunch and bring it with you plugged in your tablet and finally go back to home with your phone and call back your girlfriend if you miss her call.

And what if you are a student?

Why you should miss a party or a news for the exams your will have the day after? Use the NotiMe and get notified in time.

All these things are possible with just one device.

Which apps are yet supported?

Thanks to the partnership with LightFlow we are proud to give you the most natural, simple and COMPLETE notification system you could ever imagine.

LightFlow fully support the NotiMe and provides you a plenty of notification out of the box.

Just plug the device in your USB port and in a few second you will alerted for every important event about you.


For more information about Apps supported please refers to LightFlow website or on Google play


Some pictures for your reference:

The NotiMe comes in 5 different colors: Black, White, Green, Blue and Violet.


See how small it is (compared with 1EuroCent coin):


The NotiMe in detail:

The NotiMe has been designed to be compatible with most devices on the planet.

That’s why we choose to use the USB hardware as communication way.

The NotiMe is also self-powered and thereby it doesn’t need any additional power source; it takes energy directly from host.

To do so, the device you want to use with, must have an USB HOST or USB OTG port.

The protocol layer changes in case it is for Android device or other Operating Systems. On the latters the NotiMe is recognized as HID device giving you a driver free device.

On Android platform you need a “bridge application” which has been already developed and tested and will be published on Google Play store as soon the campaign successful ends. This application catches dedicated Intent from Android system and codifies it to be understandable by the NotiMe device.

This application can be used by any user or developer which wants to control the NotiMe giving you the abstraction level which you deserve.

IMPORTANT: No root access or special driver required. Just the bridge application already developed 

For product specification please read the table below:

Remember: The NotiMe works with USB HOST / OTG capable devices!!

If you can connect to USB mouse/keyboard or read a USB pen, of course you have compatible USB port.

Even if your device can't recognize an external mass storage, you have a chance to use this fantastic device.

To discover if your Android device is compatible with the NotiMe you have to fulfill this two requirements:

  • Android 3.1+ system with USB API (already embedded within the OS)
  • USB hardware capability.

All tablets nowadays have USB Host or USB OTG port. To be sure about it please refers to the manufacturer product specification.

Android 3.1+ devices are distributed with built in USB API.

For other Android version please use the following app available at Google Play Store:

  • USB Host Check
  • USB Host Diagnostics

Stretch Goals:



Contribute Now

Where we are at and next steps

The NotiMe is in its final stage.

The PCB has been extensively tested and we already found a reliable manufacturer.

The enclosure shape is ready to go through the last step, the injection molding.

We will be ready for shipping maximum after 45 days from the reach of the goal.

The redesign of the enclosure could take more time, but we will try to begin shipments right away the finish of campaign.

Nevertheless if the campaign reaches the goal before the official date, the redesign of the enclosure will begin immediately.


Why we think this is a useful invention.

Time is what in the modern society in more precious, and we don't want you to waste yours.

Receiving in time information about what happens around you is priceless.

What we need this money for?

  • USB unique vendor ID fees
  • Further reduction of device size
  • Pay plastic injection mold
  • Reach minimum order quantity for mass production
  • Certificate product for different country (CE, FCC etc...)
  • Crete a better looking devices with premium quality material
  • Just some other little tweaks
  • Create smaller adapter from USB to micro USB (See stretch goals)

How can you trust we will deliver it?

  • We are starting a company from the scratch. The result is going to be more than an adventure. We want to create a firm for intelligent products.
  • We finished designing all the modules and we are ready to ship it as soon as the campaign finish.
  • We have not brought dozen products to market. We will try to put in market only best product we can design, even if only one.

Frequently Asked Questions:

  1. Will the device drain my battery?
We use a low power led to ensure that your device will keep the charge as long as possible.
  1. What operating systems are supported?

Every system can communicate with NotiMe.

The NotiMe is universal. The only limitation is if your device has on board of USB host port.

  1. Does the software have Open Source license?
The NotiMe software, except for android is Open Source.
The NotiMe is compatible with Blink(1) library and all the source code used for develop application can be reused without any modification (expect for the VID/PID pair product code)
  1. Will the iPhone be supported?
Not now. IPhone cable hides an authentication chip. More research are in progress.

  1. Will the Windows phone be supported in the future? 
Yes, if Microsoft will make available device with USB HOST port. At the moment we don’t have information about windows phone with USB host capability. If you have it please contact us.
