story:
BOSS Phone is built with a focus on bringing high powered, easy to see and use, super HD large screen entertainment and social media to everyone!

  • Unlocked 4G for AT&T, T-Mobile and many other GSM networks worldwide 

  • Long battery life; four hour charge will last 20 hours of normal use

  • Tor at the Superuser level to anonymize and privatize your internet browsing


  • Beautiful display and cameras for photos and videos you will love

  • Lightning fast wifi, 4G, games and graphics 


Compatible Networks in US

  • 4GHSPA+ 21 Mbps 850/1700/1900: Nationwide AT&T: Cricket Wireless, Tracfone, Straight Talk, Net10, H20 Wireless, 420 Wireless, Black Wireless, Consumer Cellular, Pure TalkUSA, Red Pocket, Telcel America. T-Mobile: MetroPCS, Lyca, Speedtalk, Go Smart, Simple Mobile, Net10, Straight Talk, Solavei, Ultra Mobile, Telcel America, Walmart Family Mobile.

We here at BOSS are paying attention to consumer demands and have dedicated the past year to creating the perfect device to suit the whole spectrum of smartphone users’ needs. BOSS phone is the first of its kind. It has the size, power, and versatility capable of replacing your laptop, tablet, and current phone, while keeping your data incredibly private and secure. BOSS Phone can hold multiple SIM cards at the same time, while it’s equipped with expandable memory and unlocked for global GSM.

BOSS in the News

What makes this phone BOSS?

  • Super HD resolution 

  • Preloaded Play Store with millions of apps

  • Newest Android Operating System (5.0 Lollipop)

  • 64-bit True Octa-core™ LTE SoC with clock speed up to 2.2GHz

  • Compatibility with Apple music and Apple TV using included apps 

  • Bluetooth enabled for all accessories (ie. headsets, speakers)

It only takes 7-seconds to switch from your current phone to your BOSS Phone.

Why do I Need Security?

As our mobile devices become more powerful and essential to our daily lives, they’re increasingly used for more valuable tasks, like banking and shopping, and are, therefore, growing exponentially more vulnerable to a wide variety of online predators. In order to protect yourself and your family from known and unknown threats, you need to be aware of the range of security risks and how to prevent them. Data security is a complicated and rapidly changing space, and, unless you are a mobile security professional, you may find the challenge overwhelming. This is exactly why we are using Android 5.0 Lollipop for its encryption capabilities and the Tor network for secure online communication. Both of these open source systems provide the most robust and easy-to-use security available globally.

What is Tor?

Tor is free software and an open network (available as “Orbot” on Android) that helps you defend against traffic analysis, a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security. https://www.torproject.org/index.html.en

“Orbot is the only app that creates a truly private internet connection. As the New York Times writes, “When a communication arrives from Tor, you can never know where or whom it’s from.” Tor won the 2012 Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) Pioneer Award. https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/

“ACCEPT NO SUBSTITUTES: Orbot is the safest way to use the Internet on Android. Period. Orbot bounces your encrypted traffic several times through computers around the world, instead of connecting you directly like VPNs and proxies. This process takes a little longer, but the strongest privacy and identity protection available is worth the wait.” https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/

Who Uses Tor?

A wide variety of people from all walks of life use Tor. These include journalists, military personnel, law enforcement officers, corporate executives, activists, and whistleblowers. Tor serves a valuable role in the free exchange of ideas on a global level. Families use Tor to communicate globally when some members may have limited access to online communication due to geographically/nationally enforced Internet restrictions. https://www.torproject.org/about/torusers.html.en

  • BOSS Phone’s embedded privacy firmware will operate at the root level, providing unprecedented levels of privacy.

  • This special network and browser are used by everyday people, the military, journalists, law enforcement, activists, and anyone who wants absolutely secure communications and Internet browsing.

  • BOSS Phone will be submitted to the Anonymity experts at The Guardian Project for consideration of certification.



  • Made by the same team that brought you the NEO3DO, a successfully crowdfunded, specialty 8" tablet delivered to market in 2013.  We released the world's first glasses-free 3D tablet to market - NEO3DO - now available through many online retailers.


Today’s technology trends show: laptops are not selling, tablet growth is down, and phones are growing in popularity as people’s primary devices each year. But typical smart phones are prohibitively expensive, limited by carrier geography, and highly susceptible to hacking/information leaks. 

"If you support BOSS phone and within 30 days of delivery decide it is not right for you, we will offer a refund for the full amount received from your contribution." 

- David Briggs CEO


What comes with BOSS Phone?

  • SIM card adapters to ensure your Sim card fits!

  • Charger wire with wall plug and USB

  • Protective case for your BOSS with built in stand

At BOSS Phone, we have discerned the best available technologies on the market and combined them to create a no-compromises super phone. We have chosen to operate on open source Android 5.0, the most widely used and frequently updated OS with the most developers and applications. BOSS Phone is the first device to include Tor installation and functionality from the manufacturer level. At BOSS, we believe consumers shouldn’t have to be security professionals or programmers to benefit from the same level of privacy the experts use. When you support BOSS Phone, you’re helping us both to fund the initial production run and crowdsource the market validation of high value superphones.

This campaign is All or Nothing. You will pay absolutely nothing unless we reach our threshold funding level of $150,000, which amount will prove there is enough interest to justify a full production of the full featured BOSS Phone.

We are a tried and true Las Vegas-based specialty device manufacturer with a successful crowdfunding campaign under our belt and glowing reviews from our contributors. Our full story can be read at the bottom.



BOSS Phone is a next generation device with double the processing power of an iPhone, faster Internet, a bigger screen, compatibility with most networks and onboard privacy for texts, email, calls and Internet browsing - all completely and seamlessly integrated at the factory level.


BOSS is a complete solution to the mass market need for ultra-secure, multi-functional phablet devices. BOSS is a tablet sized phone that’s ideal for sharing and viewing text, photos, and videos on a device that is sleek, beautiful, and simple to use. BOSS also contains privacy and security features that protect its users from unwanted surveillance by third parties, including the FCC.

Personal cellular data privacy is a huge concern for celebrities, entrepreneurs, and everyday consumers alike. In an era ripe with mass information leaks and security hacks, when personal/professional meta data is continuously fed to the FCC, people are ready for a robust, new, low-cost, unlocked device that provides innovative, geographically anonymous/encrypted communication, plus extra long-lasting battery life, dual SIM capability, and a beautiful 7” display - while granting users the freedom to choose their own carrier.

Perks

Development & Delivery Timeline


Why Support BOSS Phone?

If you believe in high performance, feature-rich, affordable super phones with world class security, then we have what you are looking for. We want to provide our customers with options that are not currently available in any market. You can be a personal contributor to changing the smartphone market, while being the first to own BOSS Phone.

What will we do with your money?

Once we clear our threshold of $150,000, our goal is to put BOSS Phone into the hands of our supporters. The primary use of the funding is meeting the manufacturing costs, with the secondary use being the funding of the licensing agreement with Tor to pay for the certification of the installation of all Tor related firmware and software. Your orders and support will validate the market demand for BOSS Phone and we will continue working at the highest standard of quality to deliver the most functional, secure device + service available in the world.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in affordable smartphones that are unlocked with unrivaled privacy protection but want to wait until BOSS phone is post-production, you can still help!

  • Spread the word to family and friends who value sleek phablet devices, unprecedented data security, and cutting edge technology.

  • Share this campaign and help us bring this amazing new product to market!


Thank you,

Briggs & Spriggs

2014 Micro Enterprise Business Persons of The Year from the SBA Nevada

2014 SXSW V2V Finalist in Innovation Category

2013 Tech Cocktail Hottest New Start Up in Las Vegas, Crowd Favorite

2013 Tech Cocktail Celebrate National Finalist

2013 Best New Product at The 3D Film Festival



About The Company: BOSS Phone Story

BOSS Phone came to be over the course of the last three years when David and I founded NEO3DO. Our experience in designing, manufacturing and marketing the NEO3DO tablet revealed the trend towards building Android devices for the way people actually want to use them. Smartphones and tablets have evolved over the last few years into devices people use to take and share photos, watch and share videos, browse the Internet, participate in e-commerce, post to social media and (occasionally) make phone calls.

In May 2014, David made a video at his brother’s wedding in Turkey and wanted to share it on Youtube with friends and family back in the US. Unfortunately, he found out the Turkish government had mostly shut down the Internet due to political issues. Upon returning to the US, David researched how he could have posted the video and learned about the Tor network. The Tor network provides geographic and individual anonymity which allows individuals to communicate in private on a global level.

The Tor network and application are available for free, but unless you are knowledgeable about, and comfortable in, “jailbreaking” your Android device, you will not get the full benefit of Tor across all Internet traffic on the device. We found that no current smartphone manufacturer offers Tor preinstalled at the root directory level, so we saw an opportunity to provide an easy-to-use smart phone with Tor security built in from at the factory level.

Since the June 2013 news regarding Edward Snowden and mass government surveillance programs, as well as the 2013 Target hack and other financial data breaches have become wide-spread, smartphone buyers have expressed an interest in obtaining more secure devices. Android and Apple-based devices offer device level encryption, but device level encryption is only one level of security. Apple and Android devices have weaknesses and design compromises at the chip level, operating system level, network level, application level, and user level. Consumers are left wide open to various known and unknown data threats.

The topic of security is technically complex and confusing to most smartphone buyers. The need for security for most smartphone buyers is not to protect them from the government, but instead to protect them from hackers stealing financial information and data brokers tracking their personal data. We believe that the best approach to meet this security need is through integrating Tor to protect online communications.

The security features were the first design parameters we discussed and then we decided to start from scratch and design a phone from the ground up. We started by looking for the chip set that has the most performance for the least cost. Next we evaluated cellular and WiFi connection usage, then the display size and resolution, then cameras and battery life. The traditional phone model with subsidies from popular carriers doesn’t work for us. We believe in unlocked devices that can be used across multiple networks and countries with the capability to use dual SIM cards. The result is BOSS Phone. All of these technical specifications are based upon our personal experience and research into how people really use their smart phones.

The final step in bringing BOSS Phone to market is to present our vision of what a superphone should be to the Indiegogo supporters and media, in order to validate our design and value parameters. We have incorporated more features at a lower cost than Apple or Samsung. We believe that a large screen, high performance, low cost, easy-to use, secure superphone is needed and wanted by our supporters.  


Questions and Answers

Security - What Do I Need?

Q: Why do I need more security than my current smartphone offers?

 A: If you value your privacy and anonymity on the Internet and would like to protect your data and your family from unwillingly being accessed by data brokers and hackers, then you need to increase the level of security on your mobile devices.

Q: How do I stop all third parties from capturing my data without my permission?

A: You cannot stop all third parties from capturing your data without your permission unless you get rid of your mobile device entirely. What you can do is minimize your exposure to malicious third parties by using BOSS Phone and its secure link to the Tor network.  

Q: How much security is enough?

A: The answer to this question depends on the type of data you transmit over the internet. For most law abiding citizens, the government data collection programs are not a threat. What is a threat is unauthorized third party access to your personal and financial practices online. Privacy by anonymity allows one to freely explore the lawful side of the Internet without nonconsensual or warrantless gathering of one’s browsing habits.

A: If you are looking for absolute security and protection from unlawful acts, then we are not the company for you. We fully support lawful cooperation with all law enforcement agencies.

Q: How can I make an informed decision about security without becoming a security expert?

A: You can research the available options on the Internet. We have provided some links as resources. There are options from free to very expensive private networks with all proprietary hardware, operating systems and applications. We believe we are providing the lowest cost,  best combination of security that is easy-to-use for an average smartphone buyer.

Q: What is Tor and why should I care?

A: From the Tor website: “Individuals use Tor to keep websites from tracking them and their family members, or to connect to news sites, instant messaging services, or the like when these are blocked by their local Internet providers. Tor's hidden services let users publish web sites and other services without needing to reveal the location of the site. Individuals also use Tor for socially sensitive communication: chat rooms and web forums for rape and abuse survivors, or people with illnesses.”  https://www.torproject.org/about/overview.html.en

“Orbot is the only app that creates a truly private Internet connection. As The New York Times writes, “When a communication arrives from Tor, you can never know where or whom it’s from.” Tor won the 2012 Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) Pioneer Award.” https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/

Tor is the most robust online security service and it is independent from government intervention. Over 500 million users have directly accessed the Tor network and 1.3 million people use Tor daily.

Q: Will BOSS Phone replace a Tor based tablet or work over WiFi?

A: Tor works on data based cellular connections and WiFi connections.


Cellular and WiFi Connections

Q: What cellular networks and WiFi connections are available? LTE? 4G? 3G?

A: We have selected a 3G GSM based 1900/2100 Mhz cellular connectivity to provide the best balance of device cost, bandwidth cost, cellular and data connectivity for our working prototypes. We need this successful IGG campaign to fund the development of 4G, LTE, and Edge versions of BOSS Phone.

WiFi connections will be 802.11 (b)(g)(n)

Q: Why does anyone need Dual SIM?  Why is this important?  Am I going to have two phone bills now for one phone?  Or is this for international travel?  How hard is it to switch between SIM cards?

A: The dual SIM feature allows users to have two different cell phone numbers which could be from one or two carriers, and/or one or two countries. Many people have both business and personal cell phones and we believe that, given the choice, most people would rather carry one device than two. Dual SIM cards give users the choice to select a different data and voice plan at their convenience. A user can have two SIM cards from two different countries to avoid international roaming charges and, while they will have two bills, they will likely be lower together than one with a single carrier. It is very easy to setup the dual SIM cards from within the settings menu in the Android operating system.

Q: What phone companies does BOSS Phone work with?

A: The working prototype is 3G GSM compatible with AT&T and T-Mobile carriers and our delivered product will be 4G LTE compatible with most major networks.  

Q: Can people take their SIM right out of an iPhone or android phone and put it into BOSS phone?

A: Yes; if you have a 4G LTE SIM card and the carrier to mount the Mini or Micro SIM card into the standard SIM card slot.

Q: Do you need a SIM card in BOSS Phone for it to work? 

A: Yes on the 3G, with standard and micro, or smaller with carrier. The 4G LTE will also use a SIM card.

Q: Can people just use BOSS Phone when they travel? 

A: BOSS Phone can be used any time, any place.

Q: How hard is it to get an international SIM card when you travel?  

A: It is very easy to buy a prepaid SIM card for travel.


Why should I buy BOSS Phone?

Q: Why would the everyday consumer want to buy a BOSS Phone?

A: People from all walks of life will prefer BOSS Phone to conventional devices; the first thing they’ll fall in love with is the extra large display of the pictures and videos they share with each other. Facebook comes to life with a larger screen. Anyone who wants the ultimate protection for their private information, and on behalf of their children and grandchildren, will prefer BOSS Phone over standard devices.

Q: Why would a techy person want to buy BOSS Phone?

A: Techies will love having the latest chip set, the highest display resolution, and the longest lasting battery life because they are always on their smartphones. BOSS Phone is the first superphone to deliver this combined set of specifications while doing so at a reasonable price, far below Apple and Samsung.

Q: Why should someone buy BOSS Phone over a Samsung Galaxy tablet?

A: BOSS Phone is a device designed and built to a higher set of specifications than the mass marketed, lowest common denominator phones & tablets produced by Samsung. Our small size and addressable market allow us to make a more specialized device that meets the needs of discriminating consumers.

Q: Are there other 7” phones on the market?

A: Yes, however none of them are offered by American companies in the US market. BOSS Phone is designed, sold and supported in the US.

Q: How is BOSS Phone different or better than the Blackphone?

A: The Blackphone is a solid device that takes a different approach to security at a higher price point in the market. The Blackphone takes a proprietary approach to modifying the Android OS and providing application level security, where BOSS Phone takes an open source and crowdsourced approach based on hardware and network security instead. Blackphone will require users to pay annual licensing fees for their proprietary applications while BOSS Phone will not.

Q: Why is buying a phone from a small company a better idea? 

A: Buying a phone from Briggs & Spriggs is a good idea for buyers who want the largest, fastest and most secure phone available. The user who does not want the one-size-fits-most smartphone will be rewarded with a unique feature set and performance capabilities at a reasonable price. Briggs & Spriggs have a proven track record of exemplary customer service and satisfaction with the NEO3DO.

Q: Why would two men want to go up against a billion dollar industry?

A: We are entrepreneurs who want to change the phone industry. Our goal is to make an easy-to-use phone that provides users with security against hackers and data brokers. Real security requires more than simply encrypting data at rest. Our strategy of using the best available network security with Tor incorporated at the root level provides the security not offered by major manufacturers. We are simply making the phone that we knew users would want based on the features, performance and value we want in our own devices.

Q: What don't cell phone companies understand about users that you do?

A: It isn’t that the major manufacturers don’t understand their customers; it is that they are designing products full of compromises rather than designing devices full of the best available hardware and software, regardless of the source. Major manufacturers are bound to their internal engineering for hardware and software. We can embrace all available technology whether proprietary, licensed or open source. We, as a smaller company, can produce a more feature-packed device with the best available components and software, while provide this package at a lower total cost than the bigger companies. We can make our customers happy with great features, performance, value and personal customer service. At Briggs & Spriggs, you can talk to the owners and have your voice heard.


Use Cases

Q: Since BOSS Phone is affordable enough to be a second device, what do we see as the best user fit for BOSS Phone?

A: BOSS Phone has the feature set, performance, and affordability to be every consumer’s only mobile communications device. Our goal is to help people shed excess devices by designing one that allows them to leave the phone, tablet, and laptop behind.  

Q: How does BOSS Phone fit in pockets?

A: BOSS Phone will fit in most front and rear pants pockets, as well as most purse and jacket pockets.

Q: How will BOSS Phone work for selfies?

A: The 2 mega pixel user facing camera is great for selfies, and both cameras auto capture if you flash a peace sign.  


How do we make a phone with this much value?

Q: How can you make a phone with this much value, when other unlocked phones cost $550? 

A: The Briggs & Spriggs business model is based on selecting the best value components for both hardware and software. We use the latest MediaTek chip and Android OS for maximum utility and updates along with the best in open source and crowd sourced utilities to keep overall software development and licensing costs down.  

Q: How did Briggs & Spriggs go through the product development process?

A: Our process is more of a different strategic approach to designing and selecting the hardware and software components that allows us to mix proprietary, licensed, and open source components together in a way that Apple and Samsung will not or cannot. We are free to change chip sets, hardware security, operating system, and network security features as newer, better solutions come to market, rather than being tied into in house developed solutions. Our target is to sell in the single digit millions of units so we can make more specialized products that appeal to users outside of the mainstream, one-size-fits-most business model.

Q: How do you make a phone?

A: The phone development process includes selecting a chip set with modem, internal memory, operating system, display size and resolution, front and rear cameras, speakers, battery capacity in mAh, and then fitting all the components together in a stylish, light and durable case.


Other questions

Q: What kind of customer support will you offer?

A: As a small company, we provide very personal customer support. We may be the only phone company where you can talk to one of the founders by Skype, email, or phone. We enjoy speaking directly with our customers to learn what they like and don’t like about our products and that guides our future development.

Q: Is the screen fixable if it breaks?

A: Yes, the screen can be repaired if it breaks at a cost to be determined. 

Q: How long does BOSS Phone take to charge?

A: BOSS Phone takes 5 hours to fully charge from a zero charge starting point.

Q: What's inside of the phone?

A: The core component of the prototype is a MTK6592 8 core chip and 3G GSM cellular modem, combined with 16Gb of internal memory. The production units will contain the absolute latest and greatest MTK6595 4G LTE chip.

Q: Is a 7 inch phone 7 inches across screen or from top to bottom? 

A: The display measures 7 inches diagonally from bottom left to top right.


Facebook https://www.facebook.com/theBOSSphone

Twitter https://twitter.com/theBOSSphone

Website http://www.theBOSSphone.com
story_txt:
BOSS Phone is built with a focus on bringing high powered, easy to see and use, super HD large screen entertainment and social media to everyone!
Unlocked 4G for AT&T, T-Mobile and many other GSM networks worldwide 
Long battery life; four hour charge will last 20 hours of normal use
Tor at the Superuser level to anonymize and privatize your internet browsing



Beautiful display and cameras for photos and videos you will love
Lightning fast wifi, 4G, games and graphics 
Compatible Networks in US4GHSPA+ 21 Mbps 850/1700/1900: Nationwide AT&T: Cricket Wireless, Tracfone, Straight Talk, Net10, H20 Wireless, 420 Wireless, Black Wireless, Consumer Cellular, Pure TalkUSA, Red Pocket, Telcel America. T-Mobile: MetroPCS, Lyca, Speedtalk, Go Smart, Simple Mobile, Net10, Straight Talk, Solavei, Ultra Mobile, Telcel America, Walmart Family Mobile.
We here at BOSS are paying attention to consumer demands and have dedicated the past year to creating the perfect device to suit the whole spectrum of smartphone users’ needs. BOSS phone is the first of its kind. It has the size, power, and versatility capable of replacing your laptop, tablet, and current phone, while keeping your data incredibly private and secure. BOSS Phone can hold multiple SIM cards at the same time, while it’s equipped with expandable memory and unlocked for global GSM.
BOSS in the News




What makes this phone BOSS?




Super HD resolution 
Preloaded Play Store with millions of apps
Newest Android Operating System (5.0 Lollipop)
64-bit True Octa-core™ LTE SoC with clock speed up to 2.2GHz
Compatibility with Apple music and Apple TV using included apps 
Bluetooth enabled for all accessories (ie. headsets, speakers)





It only takes 7-seconds to switch from your current phone to your BOSS Phone.





Why do I Need Security?
As our mobile devices become more powerful and essential to our daily lives, they’re increasingly used for more valuable tasks, like banking and shopping, and are, therefore, growing exponentially more vulnerable to a wide variety of online predators. In order to protect yourself and your family from known and unknown threats, you need to be aware of the range of security risks and how to prevent them. Data security is a complicated and rapidly changing space, and, unless you are a mobile security professional, you may find the challenge overwhelming. This is exactly why we are using Android 5.0 Lollipop for its encryption capabilities and the Tor network for secure online communication. Both of these open source systems provide the most robust and easy-to-use security available globally.
What is Tor?
Tor is free software and an open network (available as “Orbot” on Android) that helps you defend against traffic analysis, a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security. https://www.torproject.org/index.html.en
“Orbot is the only app that creates a truly private internet connection. As the New York Times writes, “When a communication arrives from Tor, you can never know where or whom it’s from.” Tor won the 2012 Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) Pioneer Award. https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/
“ACCEPT NO SUBSTITUTES: Orbot is the safest way to use the Internet on Android. Period. Orbot bounces your encrypted traffic several times through computers around the world, instead of connecting you directly like VPNs and proxies. This process takes a little longer, but the strongest privacy and identity protection available is worth the wait.” https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/
Who Uses Tor?
A wide variety of people from all walks of life use Tor. These include journalists, military personnel, law enforcement officers, corporate executives, activists, and whistleblowers. Tor serves a valuable role in the free exchange of ideas on a global level. Families use Tor to communicate globally when some members may have limited access to online communication due to geographically/nationally enforced Internet restrictions. https://www.torproject.org/about/torusers.html.en


BOSS Phone’s embedded privacy firmware will operate at the root level, providing unprecedented levels of privacy.
This special network and browser are used by everyday people, the military, journalists, law enforcement, activists, and anyone who wants absolutely secure communications and Internet browsing.

BOSS Phone will be submitted to the Anonymity experts at The Guardian Project for consideration of certification.




Made by the same team that brought you the NEO3DO, a successfully crowdfunded, specialty 8" tablet delivered to market in 2013.  We released the world's first glasses-free 3D tablet to market - NEO3DO - now available through many online retailers.





Today’s technology trends show: laptops are not selling, tablet growth is down, and phones are growing in popularity as people’s primary devices each year. But typical smart phones are prohibitively expensive, limited by carrier geography, and highly susceptible to hacking/information leaks. 

"If you support BOSS phone and within 30 days of delivery decide it is not right for you, we will offer a refund for the full amount received from your contribution." 
- David Briggs CEO


What comes with BOSS Phone?


SIM card adapters to ensure your Sim card fits!
Charger wire with wall plug and USB
Protective case for your BOSS with built in stand



At BOSS Phone, we have discerned the best available technologies on the market and combined them to create a no-compromises super phone. We have chosen to operate on open source Android 5.0, the most widely used and frequently updated OS with the most developers and applications. BOSS Phone is the first device to include Tor installation and functionality from the manufacturer level. At BOSS, we believe consumers shouldn’t have to be security professionals or programmers to benefit from the same level of privacy the experts use. When you support BOSS Phone, you’re helping us both to fund the initial production run and crowdsource the market validation of high value superphones.
This campaign is All or Nothing. You will pay absolutely nothing unless we reach our threshold funding level of $150,000, which amount will prove there is enough interest to justify a full production of the full featured BOSS Phone.


We are a tried and true Las Vegas-based specialty device manufacturer with a successful crowdfunding campaign under our belt and glowing reviews from our contributors. Our full story can be read at the bottom.


BOSS Phone is a next generation device with double the processing power of an iPhone, faster Internet, a bigger screen, compatibility with most networks and onboard privacy for texts, email, calls and Internet browsing - all completely and seamlessly integrated at the factory level.




BOSS is a complete solution to the mass market need for ultra-secure, multi-functional phablet devices. BOSS is a tablet sized phone that’s ideal for sharing and viewing text, photos, and videos on a device that is sleek, beautiful, and simple to use. BOSS also contains privacy and security features that protect its users from unwanted surveillance by third parties, including the FCC.



Personal cellular data privacy is a huge concern for celebrities, entrepreneurs, and everyday consumers alike. In an era ripe with mass information leaks and security hacks, when personal/professional meta data is continuously fed to the FCC, people are ready for a robust, new, low-cost, unlocked device that provides innovative, geographically anonymous/encrypted communication, plus extra long-lasting battery life, dual SIM capability, and a beautiful 7” display - while granting users the freedom to choose their own carrier.

Perks



Development & Delivery Timeline

Why Support BOSS Phone?
If you believe in high performance, feature-rich, affordable super phones with world class security, then we have what you are looking for. We want to provide our customers with options that are not currently available in any market. You can be a personal contributor to changing the smartphone market, while being the first to own BOSS Phone.

What will we do with your money?
Once we clear our threshold of $150,000, our goal is to put BOSS Phone into the hands of our supporters. The primary use of the funding is meeting the manufacturing costs, with the secondary use being the funding of the licensing agreement with Tor to pay for the certification of the installation of all Tor related firmware and software. Your orders and support will validate the market demand for BOSS Phone and we will continue working at the highest standard of quality to deliver the most functional, secure device + service available in the world.




Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in affordable smartphones that are unlocked with unrivaled privacy protection but want to wait until BOSS phone is post-production, you can still help!

Spread the word to family and friends who value sleek phablet devices, unprecedented data security, and cutting edge technology.
Share this campaign and help us bring this amazing new product to market!

Thank you, 
Briggs & Spriggs



2014 Micro Enterprise Business Persons of The Year from the SBA Nevada
2014 SXSW V2V Finalist in Innovation Category
2013 Tech Cocktail Hottest New Start Up in Las Vegas, Crowd Favorite
2013 Tech Cocktail Celebrate National Finalist
2013 Best New Product at The 3D Film Festival


About The Company: BOSS Phone Story
BOSS Phone came to be over the course of the last three years when David and I founded NEO3DO. Our experience in designing, manufacturing and marketing the NEO3DO tablet revealed the trend towards building Android devices for the way people actually want to use them. Smartphones and tablets have evolved over the last few years into devices people use to take and share photos, watch and share videos, browse the Internet, participate in e-commerce, post to social media and (occasionally) make phone calls.
In May 2014, David made a video at his brother’s wedding in Turkey and wanted to share it on Youtube with friends and family back in the US. Unfortunately, he found out the Turkish government had mostly shut down the Internet due to political issues. Upon returning to the US, David researched how he could have posted the video and learned about the Tor network. The Tor network provides geographic and individual anonymity which allows individuals to communicate in private on a global level.
The Tor network and application are available for free, but unless you are knowledgeable about, and comfortable in, “jailbreaking” your Android device, you will not get the full benefit of Tor across all Internet traffic on the device. We found that no current smartphone manufacturer offers Tor preinstalled at the root directory level, so we saw an opportunity to provide an easy-to-use smart phone with Tor security built in from at the factory level.
Since the June 2013 news regarding Edward Snowden and mass government surveillance programs, as well as the 2013 Target hack and other financial data breaches have become wide-spread, smartphone buyers have expressed an interest in obtaining more secure devices. Android and Apple-based devices offer device level encryption, but device level encryption is only one level of security. Apple and Android devices have weaknesses and design compromises at the chip level, operating system level, network level, application level, and user level. Consumers are left wide open to various known and unknown data threats.
The topic of security is technically complex and confusing to most smartphone buyers. The need for security for most smartphone buyers is not to protect them from the government, but instead to protect them from hackers stealing financial information and data brokers tracking their personal data. We believe that the best approach to meet this security need is through integrating Tor to protect online communications.
The security features were the first design parameters we discussed and then we decided to start from scratch and design a phone from the ground up. We started by looking for the chip set that has the most performance for the least cost. Next we evaluated cellular and WiFi connection usage, then the display size and resolution, then cameras and battery life. The traditional phone model with subsidies from popular carriers doesn’t work for us. We believe in unlocked devices that can be used across multiple networks and countries with the capability to use dual SIM cards. The result is BOSS Phone. All of these technical specifications are based upon our personal experience and research into how people really use their smart phones.
The final step in bringing BOSS Phone to market is to present our vision of what a superphone should be to the Indiegogo supporters and media, in order to validate our design and value parameters. We have incorporated more features at a lower cost than Apple or Samsung. We believe that a large screen, high performance, low cost, easy-to use, secure superphone is needed and wanted by our supporters.  
Questions and Answers
Security - What Do I Need?
Q: Why do I need more security than my current smartphone offers?
 A: If you value your privacy and anonymity on the Internet and would like to protect your data and your family from unwillingly being accessed by data brokers and hackers, then you need to increase the level of security on your mobile devices.
Q: How do I stop all third parties from capturing my data without my permission?
A: You cannot stop all third parties from capturing your data without your permission unless you get rid of your mobile device entirely. What you can do is minimize your exposure to malicious third parties by using BOSS Phone and its secure link to the Tor network.  
Q: How much security is enough?
A: The answer to this question depends on the type of data you transmit over the internet. For most law abiding citizens, the government data collection programs are not a threat. What is a threat is unauthorized third party access to your personal and financial practices online. Privacy by anonymity allows one to freely explore the lawful side of the Internet without nonconsensual or warrantless gathering of one’s browsing habits.
A: If you are looking for absolute security and protection from unlawful acts, then we are not the company for you. We fully support lawful cooperation with all law enforcement agencies.
Q: How can I make an informed decision about security without becoming a security expert?
A: You can research the available options on the Internet. We have provided some links as resources. There are options from free to very expensive private networks with all proprietary hardware, operating systems and applications. We believe we are providing the lowest cost,  best combination of security that is easy-to-use for an average smartphone buyer.
Q: What is Tor and why should I care?
A: From the Tor website: “Individuals use Tor to keep websites from tracking them and their family members, or to connect to news sites, instant messaging services, or the like when these are blocked by their local Internet providers. Tor's hidden services let users publish web sites and other services without needing to reveal the location of the site. Individuals also use Tor for socially sensitive communication: chat rooms and web forums for rape and abuse survivors, or people with illnesses.”  https://www.torproject.org/about/overview.html.en
“Orbot is the only app that creates a truly private Internet connection. As The New York Times writes, “When a communication arrives from Tor, you can never know where or whom it’s from.” Tor won the 2012 Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) Pioneer Award.” https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/
Tor is the most robust online security service and it is independent from government intervention. Over 500 million users have directly accessed the Tor network and 1.3 million people use Tor daily.
Q: Will BOSS Phone replace a Tor based tablet or work over WiFi?
A: Tor works on data based cellular connections and WiFi connections.
Cellular and WiFi Connections
Q: What cellular networks and WiFi connections are available? LTE? 4G? 3G?
A: We have selected a 3G GSM based 1900/2100 Mhz cellular connectivity to provide the best balance of device cost, bandwidth cost, cellular and data connectivity for our working prototypes. We need this successful IGG campaign to fund the development of 4G, LTE, and Edge versions of BOSS Phone.
WiFi connections will be 802.11 (b)(g)(n)
Q: Why does anyone need Dual SIM?  Why is this important?  Am I going to have two phone bills now for one phone?  Or is this for international travel?  How hard is it to switch between SIM cards?
A: The dual SIM feature allows users to have two different cell phone numbers which could be from one or two carriers, and/or one or two countries. Many people have both business and personal cell phones and we believe that, given the choice, most people would rather carry one device than two. Dual SIM cards give users the choice to select a different data and voice plan at their convenience. A user can have two SIM cards from two different countries to avoid international roaming charges and, while they will have two bills, they will likely be lower together than one with a single carrier. It is very easy to setup the dual SIM cards from within the settings menu in the Android operating system.
Q: What phone companies does BOSS Phone work with?
A: The working prototype is 3G GSM compatible with AT&T and T-Mobile carriers and our delivered product will be 4G LTE compatible with most major networks.  
Q: Can people take their SIM right out of an iPhone or android phone and put it into BOSS phone?
A: Yes; if you have a 4G LTE SIM card and the carrier to mount the Mini or Micro SIM card into the standard SIM card slot.
Q: Do you need a SIM card in BOSS Phone for it to work? 
A: Yes on the 3G, with standard and micro, or smaller with carrier. The 4G LTE will also use a SIM card.
Q: Can people just use BOSS Phone when they travel? 
A: BOSS Phone can be used any time, any place.
Q: How hard is it to get an international SIM card when you travel?  
A: It is very easy to buy a prepaid SIM card for travel.
Why should I buy BOSS Phone?
Q: Why would the everyday consumer want to buy a BOSS Phone?
A: People from all walks of life will prefer BOSS Phone to conventional devices; the first thing they’ll fall in love with is the extra large display of the pictures and videos they share with each other. Facebook comes to life with a larger screen. Anyone who wants the ultimate protection for their private information, and on behalf of their children and grandchildren, will prefer BOSS Phone over standard devices.
Q: Why would a techy person want to buy BOSS Phone?
A: Techies will love having the latest chip set, the highest display resolution, and the longest lasting battery life because they are always on their smartphones. BOSS Phone is the first superphone to deliver this combined set of specifications while doing so at a reasonable price, far below Apple and Samsung.
Q: Why should someone buy BOSS Phone over a Samsung Galaxy tablet?
A: BOSS Phone is a device designed and built to a higher set of specifications than the mass marketed, lowest common denominator phones & tablets produced by Samsung. Our small size and addressable market allow us to make a more specialized device that meets the needs of discriminating consumers.
Q: Are there other 7” phones on the market?
A: Yes, however none of them are offered by American companies in the US market. BOSS Phone is designed, sold and supported in the US.
Q: How is BOSS Phone different or better than the Blackphone?
A: The Blackphone is a solid device that takes a different approach to security at a higher price point in the market. The Blackphone takes a proprietary approach to modifying the Android OS and providing application level security, where BOSS Phone takes an open source and crowdsourced approach based on hardware and network security instead. Blackphone will require users to pay annual licensing fees for their proprietary applications while BOSS Phone will not.
Q: Why is buying a phone from a small company a better idea? 
A: Buying a phone from Briggs & Spriggs is a good idea for buyers who want the largest, fastest and most secure phone available. The user who does not want the one-size-fits-most smartphone will be rewarded with a unique feature set and performance capabilities at a reasonable price. Briggs & Spriggs have a proven track record of exemplary customer service and satisfaction with the NEO3DO.
Q: Why would two men want to go up against a billion dollar industry?
A: We are entrepreneurs who want to change the phone industry. Our goal is to make an easy-to-use phone that provides users with security against hackers and data brokers. Real security requires more than simply encrypting data at rest. Our strategy of using the best available network security with Tor incorporated at the root level provides the security not offered by major manufacturers. We are simply making the phone that we knew users would want based on the features, performance and value we want in our own devices.
Q: What don't cell phone companies understand about users that you do?
A: It isn’t that the major manufacturers don’t understand their customers; it is that they are designing products full of compromises rather than designing devices full of the best available hardware and software, regardless of the source. Major manufacturers are bound to their internal engineering for hardware and software. We can embrace all available technology whether proprietary, licensed or open source. We, as a smaller company, can produce a more feature-packed device with the best available components and software, while provide this package at a lower total cost than the bigger companies. We can make our customers happy with great features, performance, value and personal customer service. At Briggs & Spriggs, you can talk to the owners and have your voice heard.
Use Cases
Q: Since BOSS Phone is affordable enough to be a second device, what do we see as the best user fit for BOSS Phone?
A: BOSS Phone has the feature set, performance, and affordability to be every consumer’s only mobile communications device. Our goal is to help people shed excess devices by designing one that allows them to leave the phone, tablet, and laptop behind.  
Q: How does BOSS Phone fit in pockets?
A: BOSS Phone will fit in most front and rear pants pockets, as well as most purse and jacket pockets.
Q: How will BOSS Phone work for selfies?
A: The 2 mega pixel user facing camera is great for selfies, and both cameras auto capture if you flash a peace sign.  
How do we make a phone with this much value?
Q: How can you make a phone with this much value, when other unlocked phones cost $550? 
A: The Briggs & Spriggs business model is based on selecting the best value components for both hardware and software. We use the latest MediaTek chip and Android OS for maximum utility and updates along with the best in open source and crowd sourced utilities to keep overall software development and licensing costs down.  
Q: How did Briggs & Spriggs go through the product development process?
A: Our process is more of a different strategic approach to designing and selecting the hardware and software components that allows us to mix proprietary, licensed, and open source components together in a way that Apple and Samsung will not or cannot. We are free to change chip sets, hardware security, operating system, and network security features as newer, better solutions come to market, rather than being tied into in house developed solutions. Our target is to sell in the single digit millions of units so we can make more specialized products that appeal to users outside of the mainstream, one-size-fits-most business model.
Q: How do you make a phone?
A: The phone development process includes selecting a chip set with modem, internal memory, operating system, display size and resolution, front and rear cameras, speakers, battery capacity in mAh, and then fitting all the components together in a stylish, light and durable case.
Other questions
Q: What kind of customer support will you offer?
A: As a small company, we provide very personal customer support. We may be the only phone company where you can talk to one of the founders by Skype, email, or phone. We enjoy speaking directly with our customers to learn what they like and don’t like about our products and that guides our future development.
Q: Is the screen fixable if it breaks?
A: Yes, the screen can be repaired if it breaks at a cost to be determined. 
Q: How long does BOSS Phone take to charge?
A: BOSS Phone takes 5 hours to fully charge from a zero charge starting point.
Q: What's inside of the phone?
A: The core component of the prototype is a MTK6592 8 core chip and 3G GSM cellular modem, combined with 16Gb of internal memory. The production units will contain the absolute latest and greatest MTK6595 4G LTE chip.
Q: Is a 7 inch phone 7 inches across screen or from top to bottom? 
A: The display measures 7 inches diagonally from bottom left to top right.

Twitter https://twitter.com/theBOSSphone
Website http://www.theBOSSphone.com

story:
Arduissimo

Arduissimo is a MultiCore Arduino project. It is optimized for Virtual Peripherals and is based on a Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board, which is the central element of this project:

The following picture gives an overview of how to use it:

An Arduino board usually has a chip with one processor, program and data memory and a set of peripherals. You can program it using the Arduino IDE or other IDEs like the Atmel Studio and you can use the Arduino language or other languages like C++. You download the program through the USB interface for example.

This is also true for this project. You can use the enhanced Arduino IDE - called the Arduissimo IDE - or alternatives like the Atmel Studio and languages like the Arduino language or C++ as well. The difference is, that you now have 16 processors available and more program and data memory to run your code. You have to run a minimum of 4 processors. The system has a maximum system performance of 140MHz, which means that when you use 4 processors, that each one of them is running at 35MHz. The system boots from the SD-card when applied.

But the performance increase and the multicore solution are not the only new aspects here. The cool thing is, that the system is optimized to execute virtual peripherals. Virtual peripherals provide the functionality of common peripherals like PWMs, serial interfaces etc, or any other freely user defined peripheral, but they only exist as software code.

IDE

If you want to use the Arduino IDE – instead of Atmel Studio – then don't worry. You can assign individual loops to individual processors or leave the multicore handling to the compiler. It is as simple as using the original Arduino IDE.

An additional frame lets you setup the project directory and structure. You can also define a set of sketch files for your project.


Virtual Peripherals

Virtual Peripherals replace fixed hardware peripherals with their functional counterparts in software using software code and standard GPIOs (General Purpose Inputs and Outputs). The concept of Virtual Peripherals is best explained with an example:

The picture shows how signals of a simple serial interface (cs (chip select), clk, data) change over time to transmit data. It becomes clear, that most of the time the signals remain constant. Only at specific time-points they alternate their value. This is indicated with the little vertical arrows at the timeline arrow. These actions can be handled by little software threads which modify the right signals at the right GPIOs at the right time.

This method can become very timing critical when you need multiple (many) peripherals, but you only have one processor for it (and for all the rest). This is where the MultiCore solution of this project is perfect. I has many processors available which quickly execute a thread when needed and then fall into waiting/reset mode again. There is no fixed relation between a series of threads for one Virtual Peripheral and one processor. Threads are executed on the next available processors at a given time-point.

The Arduissimo project fully supports Virtual Peripherals, it allows you to use an almost unlimited number of PWMs, I2Cs, SPIs etc. on any of the 124 General Purpose IOs. You can still use the standard Arduino Peripherals (for code compatibility for instance) and you can also use common predefined Virtual Peripherals as easy as writing Arduino code in the Arduissimo IDE. It is also possible to modify existing Virtual Peripherals or define new Virtual Peripherals. You can also use a more professional IDE like the Atmel Studio and other languages like C++ for it, as shown in this picture:

Maybe this MultiCore project optimized for the embedded world, enabling Virtual Peripherals and using standard languages and programming flows is one way how the future might look like. So be one of the very first to support it.

Emulator and Virtual Prototyping

The Arduissimo project provides an emulator. An overview of the GUI gives the next picture.

With this emulator you can debug your Arduissimo code. It lets you set breakpoints and lets you step through the code. You can check out special function register values and display port waveforms. Also a stimulie pattern can be defined. The emulator is open source java code, so anybody can modify and improve :-) it.

Sometimes emulators are limited. This is why this project supports the idea of virtual prototyping. The emulator is based on a cycle accurate C model which is automatically derived from the MultiCore Arduissimo design. This cycle accurate C model can now be embedded in your simulation model of your robot or environment model. This includes the processor and memory model of the Arduissimo processor design as well as the compiled program code. A demo project shows you how.

Low Cost FPGA Arduino (LCFA) Board

Finally, here is the specification of the magic LCFA board we were talking about all the time.

Specification details:

- Size 98.5 mm x 60 mm
- Power supply: DC 3.3V - 15V
- Xilinx Spartan-6 LX16 CSG326 -2
- EEprom for configuration file
- High Speed USB, FTDI HS2232HL (13 pins for “245 fifo sync” connected to  the FPGA)
- SDRAM Interface 1: 1x 256MBit, 4x 64MBit, 166MHz
- SDRAM Interface 2: 1x 64MBit, 166MHz
- microSD-Card holder (4 pins connected to FPGA)
- 124 IOs:
     - 4 IOs: 2,54mm header (e.g. Raspberry Pi)
     - 72 IOs: Arduino Mega footprint (44 IOs shared with uPlug)
     - 92 IOs: 8 uPlug connector slots (44 IOs shared with Arduino Mega)
- 50MHz oscillator
- Reset switch
- One magic yellow LED
- Power jack connector 2.1mm/5.5mm
- 4 nice bumpers

Raspberry Pi Bridge

There are mounting holes to place the Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board on top of your Raspberry Pi. With the right connectors you can use one of the serial interfaces or the USB interface. There is also an Arduissimo library available so that they can nicely talk to each other via SPI or USB.

In other words, your Raspberry Pi now has a flexible and large number of peripherals, something you might have already dreamed of.

uPlug (an outlook)

You might have wondered what these extra headers and screws are for. They are part of a Plug and Play system called uPlug, which is outside the scope of this campaign, but maybe subject to the next one. To explain the usage of the uPlug slots on the LCFA, the following pictures are shown.

Various modules can be plugged into these slots. This picture shows an example which you could use in your next drone project. It has a video-in, Xbee, a temperature and humidity sensor, a navigation switch, drivers for servos and motors, a GPS module, a Wifi module, LEDs and keys, an SD Card holder for your flight and video data for instance and a 3-axis accelerometer and a 3-axis gyro.

With this example you can control your little robotic car. It has a bluetooth module, two USB master interfaces to control other devices, a DAC, control modules for a stepper motors, DC motors and servos. It also shows loudspeaker, a LCD display, PMOD, Poti, LEDs and Key modules. And everything on top of a Raspberry Pi.

If you want to use uPlug as a prototyping tool, then you can automatically generate the schematic of your system after having prototyped and tested it with uPlug.


The LCFA for FPGA Nerds

Evaluation Board:

The low cost FPGA Arduino board can also be used as a nice FPGA evaluation board. The user can download his own FPGA configuration file through the USB interface. With an additional adapter board, the JTAG pins can also be accessed when a Xilinx download cable should be used.

Logic Analyzer:

The 576 MBit (@166MHz) SDRAM memory combined with the HS-USB interface makes this board ideal to be used as a logic analyzer.

OpenCores Remap:

Some SoCs from opencores.org – like the MSP430, ARMs or the OpenRisc1200 - are remapped on this board and will be released as open source.

System Configurator:

The System Configurator helps you to download a user's bitfile to the LCFA. It also lets you define your SoC to be mapped on the LCFA. This also includes customer peripherals. It does the complete compiling and tool handling for you. Since there is still space available in the MultiCore Arduino design, it allows you to add customer logic to the Arduissimo project.

The LCFA as a "subwoofer":

Last but not least, an FPGA nerd can also combine the LCFA with a standard Arduino (Due, Yun, etc.) and associated modules. This can be easily done by soldering some connection pins and using some screws. This picture shows a possible video frame grabber solution. The video input stream is decoded into digital signals using a uPlug module, the FPGA handles the video bitstream and might use the memories for data storage. The communication to the Arduino Due can be based on any of the serial interfaces for instance. Still there are plenty of IOs available on the LCFA and on the Arduino Due. I'm sure you can imagine the endless possibilities of having the LCFA as a "subwoofer" beneath any of the existing Arduino boards.

CloudX

This is the official website CloudX.cc, where all the activity around the LCFA board is organized. It covers the Arduissimo related information, uPlug as well as pure FPGA based projects from me and hopefully from others as well. Feel invited.

Motivation

The motivation for this project is the realization of an idea I had as a student. This idea multiplies the functionality of a design – like the one of a Multi-Processor for example – BUT on a very much reduced area. I was certainly not the only one having this idea, but I had a lot of fun to continue working on this technique and I think it can be very useful in today's embedded world.

I call this now further developed technique System Hyper Pipelining (SHP). This project is all about SHP, and instead of defining yet another evaluation board and compiler flow etc., I made everything Arduino compatible and created an Arduino board with an FPGA on it.

I programmed the FPGA that it provides now 16 Arduino processors using SHP technology.

Although I think that it is really cool to run more than one processor on a very small device like the Spartan-6 LX16, and I'm very proud of demonstrating it, I thought I needed something even more useful to convince you guys. So I developed the concept of virtual peripherals on top of it. Almost all “embedded” programmer emulated any kind of interface already on a CPU and the concept of virtual peripherals is certainly not new, but when you combine it with System Hyper Pipelining, it can be very efficient.

So this project is all about some ideas and about the right mix of various technologies. With this project I want do demonstrate, that you can have a very efficient SHP-based MultiCore solution already on an FPGA and that you as a user can really benefit from it. So once the system is field proven then we can think about making an ASIC out of it. Then it will be faster and even more cost efficient.

The motivation is not “how can I make the Arduino better”, it is more or less “I would like to demonstrate a promising system architecture and I use the Arduino environment for it”.

Key Messages

This project is not as fast as you might expect when you hear the word “MultiCore”. This is because the project is using an FPGA, the third smallest one of a low-cost FPGA family.

It is still a very cool achievement to get 140 MIPS out of this FPGA. Additionally the system architecture (based on System Hyper Pipelining) improves the overall system performance (e.g. less stack handling) to be more efficient than standard bus oriented SoCs.

If this system already proves (almost) cost efficient on an FPGA, then an ASIC version will certainly be very, very cost efficient.

Clarification

An FPGA is used, but no synthesis is needed for Arduissimo: 

For the Arduissimo solution a “frozen” design is used, means that it is not changed by the Arduissimo user and it will only be changed when a bug is found. Still the nerdy Arduissimo user can add customer designs to use the FPGA entirely for a new design. Only then synthesis is needed.

Virtual Peripherals: 

It is not true that one processor executes one peripheral, so that the number of virtual peripherals is limited. The algorithm of a Virtual Peripheral is sliced into individual threads. A thread is then executed on the next available processor. A Virtual Peripheral does not occupy processor resources when nothing needs to be done.

Limitation

The LCFA has no Analog to Digital Converter (ADC) implemented. But there are ADC uPlug modules as an alternative.

The Virtual Peripherals do not support high speed peripherals like gigabit Ethernet etc. It is fast enough to drive servos, motors, I2Cs, SPIs and related protocols below the range of 1MHz. 

Why Crowdfunding ?

The Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board can only be sold if the price is right. This can only be achieved when a minimum of 400 pieces is manufactured. To place an order of 400 pieces, I need your help by supporting this crowdfunding project.

Price

The price of the board is fair:

It is 65 € (~90 $) for the Indiegogo campaign (including German VAT tax).

It will be 69,90 € (~95$) in the shop after the campaign (including German VAT tax).

The Raspberry Pi bridge will be 4,90 € (including German VAT tax).

International and national shipping will be 7€.

The hardware can be compared to the “Spartan 6 LX9 Microboard, MicroBlaze” from Xilinx, which costs me 91,90 € when I buy it at RS-online today (including German VAT tax and free shipping).

Shipping

All boards come in a nice and reusable Soft-Pac.



Schedule

The prototypes have been manufactured so far by a company (X), which I use when only a few pieces are needed. The LCFA will be ordered from a different manufacturer (Y), which is cheaper for higher number of pieces. I already have received boards from them (Y) and the boards were great. Still I would like to order prototypes first from (Y), also because there are still some very minor changes to do for the Low Cost FPGA Arduino board.

This schedule is based on worst case estimations. Due to the relative high investment I planned 2 rounds of prototypes and a relatively long time for assembly and shipping.

2nd Jul '14:  Order prototypes A from manufacturer (assembly and shipping time: 35 days).

6th Aug '14:  Test prototypes A (7 days).

13rd Aug '14: Order prototypes B from manufacturer (assembly and shipping time: 35 days).

17th Sep '14: Test prototypes B (7 days).

24th Sep '14: Order final product from manufacturer (assembly and shipping time: 42 days).

5th Nov '14: Test and post-assemble final product (7 days).

12th Nov '14: Start shipping final product and release of the Arduissimo IDE.

If everything goes well and only one round of prototyping is needed, boards can theoretically be shipped as early as 13th September 2014.

Risk

The Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board did go through several versions throughout the last years. The board will go through further testing during the crowdfunding phase. The crowdfunding goal and schedule covers 2 prototype and testing phases. I consider the risk that the boards don't work as low.

The electronic parts of the LCFA are very common standard parts. I don't think that any of these will be discontinued by the manufacturer in the near future.

The Arduissimo FPGA design and the Arduissimo IDE work. Bugs can be cleared by modifying the source code.  

Thank You

Thank you for reading the story of this crowdfunding campaign. If you think that MultiCore Programing and Virtual Peripherals can be a lot of fun, then please become a supporter and help us that this project can be realized. Thanks you so much, again.

Cheers, Tobias
story_txt:
Arduissimo

Arduissimo is a MultiCore Arduino project. It is optimized for Virtual Peripherals and is based on a Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board, which is the
central element of this project:The following picture gives an overview
of how to use it:


An Arduino board usually has a chip
with one processor, program and data memory and a set of peripherals.
You can program it using the Arduino IDE or other IDEs like the Atmel
Studio and you can use the Arduino language or other languages like
C++. You download the program through the USB interface for example.

This is also true for this project. You
can use the enhanced Arduino IDE - called the Arduissimo IDE - or
alternatives like the Atmel Studio and languages like the  Arduino
language or C++ as well. The difference is, that you now have 16
processors available and more program and data memory to run your
code. You have to run a minimum of 4 processors. The system has a maximum system performance of 140MHz, which
means that when you use 4 processors, that each one of them is
running at 35MHz. The system boots from the SD-card when applied.

But the performance increase and the
multicore solution are not the only new aspects here. The cool thing
is, that the system is optimized to execute virtual peripherals.
Virtual peripherals provide the functionality of common peripherals
like PWMs, serial interfaces etc, or any other freely user defined peripheral, but they only exist as software
code. 


IDE



If you want to use the Arduino IDE –
instead of Atmel Studio – then don't worry. You can assign
individual loops to individual processors or leave the multicore
handling to the compiler. It is as simple as using the original
Arduino IDE.An additional frame lets you setup the
project directory and structure. You can also define a set of sketch
files for your project.



Virtual Peripherals

Virtual Peripherals replace fixed
hardware peripherals with their functional counterparts in software
using software code and standard GPIOs (General Purpose Inputs and
Outputs). The concept of Virtual Peripherals is best explained with
an example:

The picture shows how signals of a
simple serial interface (cs (chip select), clk, data) change over
time to transmit data. It becomes clear, that most of the time the
signals remain constant. Only at specific time-points they alternate
their value. This is indicated with the little vertical arrows at the
timeline arrow. These actions can be handled by little software
threads which modify the right signals at the right GPIOs at the right
time.

This method can become very timing
critical when you need multiple (many) peripherals, but you only
have one processor for it (and for all the rest). This is where the
MultiCore solution of this project is perfect. I has many processors
available which quickly execute a thread when needed and then fall
into waiting/reset mode again. There is no fixed relation between a series
of threads for one Virtual Peripheral and one processor. Threads are
executed on the next available processors at a given time-point.The Arduissimo project fully supports
Virtual Peripherals, it allows you to use an almost unlimited number of PWMs, I2Cs,
SPIs etc. on any of the 124 General Purpose IOs. You can still use the standard Arduino Peripherals (for code
compatibility for instance) and you can also use common predefined
Virtual Peripherals as easy as writing Arduino code in the Arduissimo
IDE. It is also possible to modify existing Virtual Peripherals or
define new Virtual Peripherals. You can also use a more professional
IDE like the Atmel Studio and other languages like C++ for it, as
shown in this picture:

Maybe this MultiCore project optimized
for the embedded world, enabling Virtual Peripherals and using
standard languages and programming flows is one way how the future
might look like. So be one of the very first to support it.


Emulator and Virtual Prototyping

The Arduissimo project provides an
emulator. An overview of the GUI gives the next picture.


With this emulator you can debug your
Arduissimo code. It lets you set breakpoints and lets you step
through the code. You can check out special function register values
and display port waveforms. Also a stimulie pattern can be defined. The emulator is open source java code, so anybody can modify and improve :-) it.



Sometimes emulators are limited. This
is why this project supports the idea of virtual prototyping. The
emulator is based on a cycle accurate C model which is automatically
derived from the MultiCore Arduissimo design. This cycle accurate C model can now be embedded in your simulation model of your robot or
environment model. This includes the processor and memory model of the Arduissimo processor design as well as the compiled program code. A demo project shows you how.


Low Cost FPGA
Arduino (LCFA) Board

Finally, here is the specification of
the magic LCFA board we were talking about all the time.

Specification
details:- Size
98.5 mm x 60 mm- Power supply: DC 3.3V - 15V- Xilinx Spartan-6
LX16 CSG326 -2- EEprom for configuration file- High Speed USB,
FTDI HS2232HL (13 pins for “245 fifo sync” connected to  the
FPGA)- SDRAM Interface 1: 1x 256MBit, 4x 64MBit, 166MHz- SDRAM
Interface 2: 1x 64MBit, 166MHz- microSD-Card holder (4 pins
connected to FPGA)- 124 IOs:     - 4 IOs: 2,54mm header (e.g.
Raspberry Pi)     - 72 IOs: Arduino Mega footprint (44 IOs shared with
uPlug)     - 92 IOs: 8 uPlug connector slots (44 IOs shared with Arduino
Mega)- 50MHz oscillator- Reset switch- One magic yellow
LED- Power jack connector 2.1mm/5.5mm- 4 nice bumpers
Raspberry Pi Bridge



There are mounting holes to place the
Low Cost FPGA Arduino Board on top of your Raspberry Pi. With the
right connectors you can use one of the serial interfaces or the USB
interface. There is also an Arduissimo library available so that they
can nicely talk to each other via SPI or USB.

In
other words, your Raspberry Pi now has a flexible and large number of
peripherals, something you might have already dreamed of.


uPlug
(an outlook)

might have wondered what these extra headers and screws are for. They

scope of this campaign, but maybe subject to the next one. To explain the usage of the uPlug slots on the LCFA, the following pictures are shown.

Card holder for your flight and video data for instance and a 3-axis
accelerometer and a 3-axis gyro.






With

story:
My name is Ricardo Gomes and I founded ColdZero in August 2005.

In the begining we focused mostly on selling watercooling components for the Portuguese market. We shifted our core business and went global in 2012. We are now dedicated to making parts for computer cases. Since then, our products gained a lof of popularity and found their away into a lot of high end projects all arround the world.

We are very focused on quality and precision, so we've been investing in machinery to increase the quality of our current products as well as making even more parts for all you guys. Everyone who knows ColdZero knows that our parts are synonyms of quality and very reasonable prices.

Now, I want to take ColdZero to the next level. Some of many the custom part requests we get are for parts with color logos/text and that is something that's not currently possible to make, without a Uv Printer. It really pains me that we can't fulfill each and every one of your requests.

So this is where you come in. By helping us purchase the Uv Printer, you will be helping us grow even more and faster than we could on our own. This will allow us to make even better looking parts to make your projects that much cooler. It will give us the ability to customize your parts to a whole new level, something i believe all of you have been deserving for a while, so instead of waiting to get the funds by ourselves sometime down the road, we're hoping to get you involved in this project, because after all, it is for you and your satisfaction that we're doing it. So that you to enjoy the new parts now, rather than later.


Due to the way this project works in our country, we've set our financial goal conservatively low, because If we can't meet the goal, all money is refunded back to the contributors. If this first campaing is sucessfull we may consider launching another if there are still more people wanting to help us and benefit from the great offers we have for them.


Let's talk numbers. A Uv printer costs arround 20 000€ + vat. Depends on brand and options selected of course. We will be validating each of the models we have in mind in the weeks to come.

This is not a going to be a "money for nothing" or a charity project. I've created the perk levels so that you can give us the initial finantial boost we need and after the printer is here, you can collect your rewards.

The way I tought of rewarding you is by issuing 1 year discount vouchers, with variable percentages based on the amount funded. There won't be a limit to how much you can purchase or a number of times you can use them, meaning the more you use them, the more you benefit/save. You can use it to buy parts for you and/or your friends as well. Vouchers will be valid for any parts on the store, not just the ones we will be able to make with the printer. Keep in mind that the discounts will apply only to the parts themselves, not the shipping costs (maybe by the time the project ends Dhl will give us better rates). The expiry date will only start after the project has been finalized and each voucher will be linked to each contributors account on our store.

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can always spread the word to other people who may not have heard of this project and might want to contribute, this is a great help already.

To all of you who will help us, directly or indirectly, I thank you in advance.

kind regards,
Ricardo
